description:
The quality of food is much better as compared to what it was 6 months back when I last went there 
The service is also improved and need more focus on food quality  anyways it was better experience than last time
author: Prakhar G.

description:
They have been giving very bad service since a long time now. Whenever I call them to give them delivery, they always say that there is not driver. They mentioned that since your home is 5 miles away so we do not have driver to send the order.

They have been cancelling my grubhub orders as well. Very disappointed
author: Vivan B.

description:
Had the masala and it was bad. Possibly the worst I ever had. Also asked for it to be prepared a certain way from the option dropdown and my request was ignored. I think they are too busy to handle the late night demand (wish other places would wake up to this). Anyway, this is a newer place that is just not up to par. Its also more expensive than the others. I paid over $30 for 1 meal that I tossed half of. 

Aslam Rosoi or Pakwan are much better choices. If you can make it to the tenderloin, you can't beat Shalimar. 

2 stars because I am trying to be nicer with my reviews.
author: H K.

description:
What a shame. This was a super south Indian place and now it is the worst Indian food ever. The delivery has become pretty unreliable as well. My last 2 orders were awful. The last, yes I gave it one more try, was a specialty tamarind leaf curry that was soooooo sour/bitter AND spicey spicey to the point of being inedible. The few bites I got down trying to believe I hadn't just paid dearly for a meal I could not eat, kept me in the banio half the night in great discomfort.
The rice is now some cheap funky stuff that tastes like cardboard.  The proteins are poor quality meats that are clearly dumped in, old and precooked so it's dry, tasteless, and full of grisel. 
How is it ya'll  are getting these reviews and not making changes, you clearly had quite a few loyal regulars but you continue to sell bad food?
author: Katherine A.

description:
Deccan Spice is the worst Indian place I've eaten at in recent memory. I ordered the chicken tikka masala, and the actual meat was terrible. I've had better-prepared and better-cooked meat from unlicensed street taco vendors. The sauce was mediocre at best.

The reason I'm giving this two stars instead of one is that I've only had warm and pleasant interactions with the employees and management. Nice people, but this is not an Indian restaurant I intend to be back to.
author: Vaibhav M.

description: Never again. The first couple times we came here the food was so good, that I keep wanting to try it again. Placed an order for delivery 2 hours ago, and we're still waiting. If you want to eat, don't order from here. There's plenty of other good Indian places in Mission.
author: Trena M.

description:
I've eaten in and ordered takeout and delivery. The food here is great, and it's great that they're open late. I think I've decided that this is going to be my go-to Indian delivery spot from now on.

I'm surprised by all the negative reviews, but maybe I've always had positive experiences because I get food here during off-peak late night hours...

Love the mixed veg pakora, but it's best eaten in since it's fried. Naan is always warm, fluffy, and toasty, and all the curries I've had have been tasty. Love the chicken korma and butter chicken. Deccan Style biryani is also delicious - though on the smaller side in terms of portion-size. Everything is on the smaller side, in fact, considering the price but I don't consume normal person portions of food. 

For me, as a spicy food lover, I found medium to be not quite spicy enough.
author: Ashley S.

description: First time ordering Togo here and it was the worse Indian food I had ever had. I gave an extra star because the combo plate of meat and naan was good but the naan is pricy $5 garlic naan and &4 for regular. The mango lassi is good. The rest was awful. The tiki masala and butter chicken were both water down with no flavor... we had to toss it since it was not edible And it cost us $14 for each. Really? I'm like wow really ? Never ever again. I would not recommend this place. SF have so many really good Indian food. One of the most disappoint meals we have ever had. My brother is now traumatized with Indian food. So sad.
author: Christy V.

description: The I won't order from here again. The mulligatawny soup was basically broth, no chunks of veggies or anything - just a few sprigs of cilantro I think - not very flavorful either. Look at the photo on their page, it looks nothing like what we received especially not for $5.95. Then the Raitha was like cloudy water - not a thicker, yogurt base - and no chunks of veggies again. Not the green sauce Raitha, I actually ordered the white yogurt type for a side, and the photo on their page doesn't look watery, it looks thick. False advertising, and plain old charging more for colored water. The Tandoor platter and garlic naan were fine (not great) - overall very disappointed. And when contacted the restaurant basically said too bad. Sad, many other great Indian places out there.
author: Andrew U.

description: Very nice variety of food, especially if you're vegetarian. Service is slow, however. Don't expect a speedy water refill or drink delivery if you order a drink. Also, prices are more expensive than Cafe Masala up the street, but selection is greater, so I understand. Expect about $30 for 2 at lunch, with iced tea.
author: J L.

description: Deccan spice has lost its quality of food with it's services. Their food is always so soggy without any taste or spices. Chicken isn't well cooked or crispy. Their biryani is nothing but masala rice. Food seems to be old that's been sitting there for days. Food has nothing but color in it. I got an upset stomach after eating like 2 bites. HATE THIS PLACE!!!!!! Never go there!!
author: Praveen A.

description: I am appalled by this place. Their biryanis are tasty, so I have to give the 2 stars. Rest of the food is just ok. Their idli/dosa breakfast style food is actually bad. What bothers me is their appalling attitude, we paid 13.95$ for malai kofta curry and got 3 kofta balls in a big tub of gravy. Just think of that 3 small koftas for 13.95$. When I asked the waiter if this is intentional, he said: "this is what you get for what you paid". No sir, this is pretty much robbing the customer.  Same goes for egg masala. If you want good biryani, order delivery from this place, suggest not ordering anything else. Avoid the bad customer service and avoid getting ripped off.
author: Balu V.

description:
I am very saddened to announce that after being a regular here for over a year now, Deccan Spice and I will be taking a break.

I know. I know. It's hard. You were so good in the beginning. I had been looking for some good Indian food for so long. You needed customers, and I needed some good Saag Paneer. It was a mutually beautiful relationship. 

But I am sorry. It's gotten pretty bad here. We had been coming here at least two times a week for the past year, and the last two times we came, it was not good.

The first whammy came when the Saag Paneer came to our table and it tasted sour. Not just this "hint of acid" type thing, I mean - just sour. Like way too much vinegar had been put in it. I never do this, but I sent it back. I told the waiter that it tasted sour. 5 minutes later, the waiter brings the same dish back out and he says that the cook said it's fine, that it just needed more cream.

We tried it and it tasted like vinegar with a bunch of cream. 

Look. I know I am not Indian. And my dining companion is not Indian. And that we are in San Francisco and not India. So maybe I don't know what real Saag Paneer tastes like, but I have had plenty of Saag Paneer. I've had Saag Paneer at Deccan Spice probably a dozen times or so, and it did not taste like this. This was quite disturbing to me because this act felt quite derogatory and I feel belittled like "Oh, dumb westerners don't know what Saag Paneer tastes like - just add more cream." 

This was very hurtful honestly because we have been such regulars, eating at Deccan Spice 2 times per month for the last year. So yeah, it was a punch in the heart. 

Even with this terrible experience, we went back again, and our whole meal was very meh. The mulligatawny soup which was heaven for a while, tasted bitter and it clearly did not have the same spices and ingredients it us to. It use to be a complex soup. Now it just tastes like grounded up lentils.

And the curries we got - they were not vinegary like last time, but they were underwhelming. Very average.

With these two whammies, we found a new place we like very much called Lotus SF that's not too far away. I suggest you try them.

Look. I really don't like to trash businesses. I only write bad reviews when I really want to say something. I just don't believe in screwing up other people's businesses. But when we started eating there, the food tasted like someone cared. And the manager there cared about its customers. Whoever is running this place now is not doing a good job. And that's my intention for writing this review is to let the owners know this. We were regulars here for over a year, so at this point, we've probably spent over $1,000 at Deccan Spice. And we will not be coming back... not for a while.
author: Bonnie H.

description:
Congratulations Deccan Spice, you're the worst indian restaurant in America. 

I got the chicken tikka masala and some kind of pudding. Pudding was extremely tough and tasted like charcoal. The masla was watery and tasted bland. 

Absolute garbage.

Go to the super market, buy any indian food in sight, it'll be 10x better than this place.

This place is disgusting and the chef should be thrown in fucking jail.
author: Pavan K.

description: It sais that they are open untill 1 am and we went there with friends last night it was 11:45 , we entered they didn't even say welcome or nothing else. After i told can we sit they said we are closing not even a single word like "sorry" and we came there like 8 mile way so overall they were too mean.
author: İsmail Cem E.

description:
I had a disappointing experience. I expected more after seeing the high reviews on yelp. I ordered the following
* Schezwan Gobi - Taste was decent but was not seasoned well. I think correct amount of salt would have given it a good taste. Also I had asked that it be made medium spicy but it was pretty mild
* Vegetarian Dum Biryani - Worst of all the dishes I ate. It only had 1 piece of carrot and a few small pieces of cauliflower and broccoli and some peas. So 95% of the dish was spiced rice and really bad at that . How do you call this a biryani? Cant believe I paid $11 for this.
* Paneer Loly Loly - The gravy was on the sweeter side so did not particularly enjoy it. It only had 7 pieces of paneer and gravy.

I don't think the prices are justified for the quality of the food.
author: Umang D.

description: Delicious food till 3AM. And people at the restaurant are very nice and accommodating.
author: Suparna J.

description:
I love their food, but their delivery is bothersome. 

They don't bother to ring my door, which is the only way I can buzz them inside from the cold. They instead call my phone, but they don't ask me anything, they just say they're "here." Where is that? "Here, out front, at your address." If they're asking me to come to them, I can, but sometimes they're at the front door, sometimes they're in a parked car down the block across the street. And then they hassle for a tip. 

But the food's great.
author: Jade P.

description: We order takeouts almost once every month and the taste has been consistently authentic (yes, most restaurants in SF don't do authentic South Indian dishes). Their biryanis and chettinad curries are highly recommened.
author: P B.

description: This place used to be our one of the  favorite and regular place for serving Indian food. We went there after almost 6 months, but the quality has deteriorated. They said they have changed the gravies. Ordered Andhra Chicken curry, the gravy was something else and the chicken was stale. The biriyanni also had only 2 pieces of chicken drumsticks. I recommended this place because of it's quality earlier to my friends now i don't think neither anyone of them nor we will be dining there
author: Bon Vivant R.

description: My boyfriend got food poisoning from one of the vegetarian curies and soup on 8/11/2018.
author: Loren F.

description:
I had been craving Indian food for a couple of days. When the roommate and I were trying to decide what to get for lunch, I picked Deccan Spice. We place our order on Sunday, June 11th at 2:10pm through Delivery dot com. Our delivery order arrived at 3:49pm. We live in Outer Richmond.

*Samosa: Vegetarian, Fried homemade street food style pastry with savory filling such as with potatoes, onions, peas and spices ($5)
*Andhra Curry Entree: gluten-free, Curry stewed in onions, mustard seeds, curry leaves and special andhra spices ($12), Chicken (+$1)
*Tikka Masala Entree: Glunten-free, Popular orange Indian dish cooked in an exotic creamy yogurt sauce with tangy tomatoes, bell peppers and onions ($12), Chicken (+$1)
*Vindaloo Entree: gluten-free, Cooked in a goan style with tomatoes, potatoes, vinegar, fresh ginger and spices with a touch of red wine ($13), Chicken (+$1)
*Special Naan: Naan generously topped with special selection of toppings with a touch of traditional delicacy to pinch your taste buds - Onion Kulcha, Garlic Naan, Chili Naan ($5 each)

All the curries came with rice. We had asked for the tikka masala and vindaloo extra spicy, so there was some heat in those dishes. I could have gone even spicier though. The vindaloo had the best flavor. Savory and comforting. My go to, the tikka masala was creamy, but it was a little too nutty for me. We decided to try something new, so we got the andhra curry as well. Way too sweet for me. I wished we had ask for that extra spicy as I think it would have cut into the sweetness. But we were trying something new, so we decided to try it as is. The naan was good. Soft, fluffy, and had a nice chew. Good for sopping up the curry. The samosas were kind of disappointing. Over fried, so super hard on the outside. Not sure if they are always like this, but I'd suggest passing on the app. We did get a Mango Lassi: A refreshing churned yogurt drinks, Large size available only, which I believe runs $5 if you order it. I'm not a huge fan of this drink, so we actually ended up tossing it.

Very average Indian food experience. And kind of pricey for what it was. Even though the curries came with rice, I wished they priced them lower and didn't include the rice as we didn't even eat it. I did like that they used real peppers to spice up the curries though. Overall, three stars.
author: Elena N.

description: The Hyderabadi Dum Biryani was good but lukewarm. The Vindaloo was skimpy on the lamb and had no potatoes, seemed rushed and very oily. Flavor wise, I am not unsatisfied.
author: Maya P.

description: We reached late last night .. 7 of us almost at closing 3am, but the guys at deccan spice were helpful, and provided quality food!!
author: Shreyas S.

description:
What happened to this place?  Food was excellent when it first opened.  Quality and health score has gone down.

We mostly ordered takeout.  The restaurant ambiance?  None.  It's a hole in the wall that is weirdly decorated.  Up top is a cheesy chandelier that would look at home in Donald Trump's bathroom.

Back to the food.  Food prices are ridiculously high for what you get.  A plain nan costs $4 which is double what you pay for elsewhere.

Taste is mediocre. I asked why their Chicken 65 is mushy and has no fresh curry leaves (a key ingredient).  They responded it's all made ahead of time into a paste.  No fresh ingredients!  Well it tastes nothing like the real deal.

They don't have a tandoor so you taste blandness in their supposedly grilled meats.

IMO Aslam's Rasoi still is the best for tandoori meats and curries and Pakawan for biryanis.
author: J B.

description:
This was my 4th time eating Deccan Spice, and while my first 3 experiences were amazing (as evidenced by my previous 5 star review), this recent experience was disappointing.

The food we ordered was simply not very good:

1) Chili chicken roll - extremely spicy, and overfilled with onions and mayo.  This was nothing like other Indian rolls I've had, and was frankly kind of gross.

2) Gobi Manchurian roll - while better than the chicken roll, this was still way too spicy and had way too much onion.

3) Deccan Special Biriyani - Medium Spice Level - this was too spicy for us (and much spicier than the previous "spicy" biriyanis we've gotten from here)!  The battered, fried chicken in the dish was unexpected and "fusion-y" - definitely not normal for biriyani.

We ordered delivery via Yelp, and the food arrived pretty quickly (within 40 minutes), which we appreciated.

Overall, it is sad to see Deccan Spice let us down after our multiple positive experiences there.  We'll have to think hard before ordering from them again.
author: Barnali D.

description: Ordered two each of the idli and vada plates. First of all, it's supposed to come with three chutneys but only came with two that tasted horrible (way too much garlic for South Indian chutneys). The vadas were too small and tasted stale and old, and the idlis were hockey pucks. The only thing I liked was the sambar, which they did not give enough of. The rasmalai was pretty good also, I'll give them that. Overall, do not recommend. I'm going to go back to ordering from Chennai Kings because their idlis and vadas are big, fresh, soft, and fluffy.
author: Sunny S.

description: Amazing authentic indian food available till late night. Great service. Prashant and his team served us well even though we reached at the closing time. Kudos to the management.
author: Ankit P.

description:
We went to the restaurant with high hopes given the 4 star rating. But we're quite disappointed!

The tea was delivered in a cracked cup and was cold. So had to send it back. 

I ordered a dosa and what was presented was something between a dosa and an uttapam! Samabhar was strictly ok and chutney serving made you feel that it was a precious commodity. 

Given the quality of the food and service (had to ask for water three times) I m surprised that they think their food warrants such high prices! I would rather go to udipi or dosa down the street for much higher quality food.
author: Gaurav S.

description: Interesting menu with items you don't always see at other Indian restaurants. Love the chicken biriyani.
author: David T.

description:
I ate here last night and had a 5 star experience. Let me first start by telling you how I found this place. A friend who was born and raised in India took my best friend here one night over a year ago. She painstakingly scoured Yelp to try and find this restaurant again, especially after two other Indian friends had eaten here and given their stamp of approval. 

The food was honestly so delicious that I forgot to take pictures. I split a bottle of wine, butter chicken, two orders of garlic naan, vindaloo, cashew curry and chaat with two other adults. We each had our favorite, so you just need to decide what is the best for yourself. 

The service was great, so I don't know why there are so many crabby haters on this Yelp page. The ambiance was also cozy. I will be eating here again, especially since they are open so late!
author: Maritza M.

description:
To ensure that this post is not deleted, let me be perfectly clear about the piss-poor customer service of Deccan Spice.  I ordered delivery from Deccan Spice with no issue and the food was great.  The second time I ordered from Deccan Spice, the delivery person didn't ring my door bell!  But I did get a call from the restaurant, letting me know that the delivery was attempted and long gone.

"How did your delivery person attempt a delivery without ringing my doorbell," I asked.

"I don't know.  We called you." 

So like I said in my first review, "Why these fucking idiots didn't ring my doorbell is beyond me."
author: Eric J.

description:
LEGIT.

Y'all, don't get hung up on the service. It's a not-very-pricey Indian restaurant in the Mission; don't expect fancypants suave service. Just go knowing what to expect and don't fret.

This place is currently at the very tippy-top of my list of Indian places where I'm willing to eat. I have zero issue with slow or head-scratch-inducing service; I do have very high standards for Indian food. Don't ask why. There are Reasons.

The Deccan Special biryani is yummy, as is the Chicken 65. The paneer saagwala was met with approval by friends. The samosas were fresh, with properly flaky pastry. Not really sure why you're still reading? Just get the food.
author: Neha B.

description: The worst food ever. I told them to give me fresh and mild food and they ended up giving me old, soggy, extra spicy food. Since i got out of the restaurant I've this really terrible stomach ache. I haven't gotten out of bathroom since I got home. And the service is so bad and the manager was so rude that he basically hung up on me. I got some togo food for my friends too and they got sick too. Chefs have changed probably and the food keeps getting worse. Idk how old the food was which they served me. Probably pretty old. Will never go back there
author: Mahima D.

description: Passion consistency and maybe new employees lol restaurants all have there ups and downs but my gosh get it together this restaurant has sooo much potential .. I hope they reach a steady good point because as you notice the good and bad reviews are consistent ... For the most part the flavors spices and traditional recipe is definitely there with the mix between fresh and so not ... So disrespectful  lol  somehow this food was still amazing just imagine if they gave their full potential
author: Jimmy B.

description:
Ordered 4 entrees and three sides of naan through Uber Eats, but one entree was missing upon delivery- which is extremely disappointing and honestly unacceptable. Both the restaurant and Uber Eats are responsible for the negligence in forgetting to pack my order of Chicken Tikka Masala. 

I say this because I have worked at a restaurant which partnered with third party companies such as DoorDash and Uber Eats, and as a worker it was my complete responsibility to make sure the order was complete before handing it off to the driver. (This is a commonly used practice instilled within diligent workers.) In my experience, all our drivers double checked the orders they were picking up. Ultimately I blame the restaurant because they're the ones handling the food to begin with. 

As for the food we did receive, 2 orders of chicken tandoori, 1 tandoori platter, garlic naan, butter naan and garlic cheese naan, everything tasted delicious, which pissed me off because I wanted the food to taste like shit so I could have more of a reason to hate this place. But unfortunately everything was flavorful.  

As for the tikka masala, I'll never know and may never know.
author: Ingrid E.

description:
Came here for a business trip and stopped by because I was missing some authentic Indian food. this was the best food I have ever gotten at 1am at night in my food filled life. I mean the butter chicken was so fantastic I felt like moving to San Fran after eating here. Lol 
Honestly though amazing food and I won't lie to you a little pricey for the portion but it's San Fran so I expected it. Def try butter chicken, when I come back again to San Fran I know exactly where I am going.
author: Raza K.

description: You know an Indian spot is legit if over 3/4 of the people in the restaurant are Indian. Great place for vegetarians and vegans too. What else is there to say?
author: Stefan M.

description:
I wish I knew why so many people gave this place such great ratings because I had high hopes. 

First of all the lunch special chicken platter says choice of 2 chicken dishes but 1) you have no choice and it comes with whatever they want to give you and 2) it only comes with 1 chicken curry dish. But it comes with rice and roti and a small biryani and a dal dish. Along with some breakfast dough and dessert thing. So it's a nice spread. 

The chicken curry they served was sweet and oily. He said it would be a little spicy.  Nope. Almost no flavor other than sweet and oily. At least the chicken was tender. I think it was the first chicken curry on the menu. 

The biriyani tasted like the clumped some biriyani spice in a bowl of white rice. The flavors were not deep and flavorful. 

The lentils tasted burned. 

The fish tikka was tilapia and it was dry. 

Rice was hard. 

Mango lassi was different. Very yogurt-y. Not bad not like other places (I don't like it too sweet anyway) but it was kind of warm. 

The water they serve is warm also. 

Small and claustrophobic spot. 4 booths and maybe 8-10 two tops. And it's hot inside. No ventilation. 

I want to try it again because of the reviews and I would try the chicken tikka masala. But with all the other great spots in town it's gonna be tough to motivate to try it again.
author: Traci H.

description:
This curry at this place is very flavorful, and by very flavorful I mean too flavorful.  I don't know if that's a good or bad thing but it was a bad thing for me because I got tired of the taste WAY too quick and by the end of my meal I had to drink water after each bite to get the taste out of my mouth. The curry came with rice that we shared, definitely made the curry a little better.  The inside of this place is very small but it was a cozy feeling to it. I order the chicken tikka masala a long with garlic nan.The curry was best with the garlic nan, their nan here is delicious, and I could really taste the garlic in it. 

Don't get me wrong the food was good but the flavor in my curry was too intense for me.
author: Sherry L.

description:
This restaurant is simply amazing for 2 basic reasons:
1) Is OPEN until 4 am on a Saturday Night (I guess the only restaurant in SF)
2) Food is simply amazing (easily in Top 10 Indian Restaurants in Bay Area)

Please try the Mysore Masala Dosa and Paneer Tikka Masala without fail
Prices are decent too

Definitely going to visit it each time I go to SF

CONS:
Parking on the street on a weekend can become an issue (Prefer to go by Taxi/Uber or other service)
author: Pratham V.

description: Ordered a delivery of the goat vindaloo. It was an expensive horrible mess that I ended up throwing out. Summary: 25% grease, 20% bone fragments, 15% goat meat with gristle, 15% red chili peppers, and 25% bland congealed sauce. The random bone fragments made it almost dangerous to eat. So disappointed.
author: Erik T.

description:
I wish I had better things to say about Deccan Spice because I wanted to like it.  My wife and I came on a Wednesday right at 5pm when they opened.  We were the only ones in the restaurant and were sat immediately.  Our waiter brought over menus and we took some time to make our choices.  I ordered the Mulligatawny soup (lentil) and my wife chose the samosa.  For our main dishes we got the Chicken Tika and Andhra curry with garlic naan. My soup came out fairly quickly and was enjoyable, the rest of the meal was kind of downhill from there.  The single biggest issue was bad service we received from our waiter.  It wasn't that he was rude, he just was inattentive and seemed like he did not want to be there. Specifically the issue is that we received this extremely poor service when we were the only table in the restaurant, so it wasn't like he was "slammed" with a bunch of other tables.    While I ate my soup we continued to wait on my wife's samosa.  It ended up coming out simultaneously with her main course, which I'll admit is pretty annoying, timing the appetizer to come out before the main course is pretty basic. My main dish came out shortly afterward.  We quickly tried to finish out appetizers so we could enjoy our main courses while they were still warm.   The Chicken tika, was okay, but many of the pieces of chicken were dry and over cooked. My curry was good, but nothing mind-blowing.  We were never given knives, and the chicken tika came in large chunks that needed cutting, our water remained empty for extended periods of time, and while my wife was interested in ordering a glass of wine, our waiter never asked us if we'd like anything to drink and each time he would stop by the table he'd leave so quickly we didn't have the chance to ask for anything additional.  Meh...

Another review mentioned it and it rang true to me.  While we were sitting at our table, we saw delivery people coming and going almost constantly.  It really appears that Deccan is prioritizing their delivery service and forgetting those that choose to "dine-in".
author: Nick G.

description:
Solid Indian place with home cooked Indian flavors and spice level customized to your liking. 

I came here during lunch time and it's very laid back. The food is served home comfort style on one platter. The Roti tasted earthy. Unlike other Indian places with too much oil that results in a stomachache, the meal was light and flavorful. The chicken curry was right on point with tender meat. 

The lentil soup had a bit of kick. And one can customize level of spicy-ness by speaking to the waiter.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
I ordered chicken Haleem through ubereats and ended up getting cooked chicken pieces with some gravy filled with whole coriander seeds.

Utterly disappointed and was a total waste of money.
author: Harsha K.

description:
Very disappointed... food tasted like it was cooked days ago and heated up in the microwave.
Lamb kabob so dry it was unedible. 
Chana Masala was all sauce and no pea.
Saagwala was the only edible dish.
$65.00 wasted
author: Mike T.

description:
Now every once in a while, you run into a terrific Indian restaurant right out of the gate. I have to admit I got nervous when I saw the crowded and compact space, and I was placed smack dab in the middle where a woman had a huge backpack to maneuver around and the diner next to me inadvertently flung a dosa in my direction as she was packing her to-go container. Truth be told, I only came here because my original choice, Laksa on Guerrero, was closed on Tuesday. Who closes on Tuesday? Since my mind was on five-spice chicken, I didn't have a clue what to order at a place that specializes in Hyderabadi dishes.

I first ordered the $8 Ponganaalu because it frankly said "steamed donuts" but they were savory ones with onion. Unfortunately they had already run out of those, so I asked the smiling female server what she suggested, and she immediately told me to try the $13 Sandwich Dosa. Disregarding the $5 mark-up for a second, I was thrown by the "sandwich" part of the description. I was wondering if it came on pumperknickle with a dab of mayo, so I said why not. Soon out came a huge tray with what looked to be an Indian-style quesadilla though they referred to it as a "thin creep". Whatever it was was surprisingly delicious. It was quartered with each stuffed with cabbage, potato, tomato, cheese and onion, like, uh...a sandwich.

It came with three chutneys, a yogurt dipping sauce, and little bowl of daal (photo: http://bit.ly/2bm62tF). I was already geting stuffed when my entree came out, the $15 Hyderabadi Goat Korma, so tasty tender with the goat still attached to some of the bones. all of it bathing in a creamy cashew, almond and coconut sauce that definitely required a $4 side of white rice to sop most of it up (photo: http://bit.ly/2bwOMi5). Two dishes, two winners. I'd like to come back with Jamie W. and try some more. The one hiccup was the server asking me to Yelp the place then and there to get a 10% discount. Honey, nobody rushes me through one of my reviews.

FOOD - 4 stars...south Indian dishes done right...need to try some more sometime
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...honestly too cramped for my ample derriere
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...cheery if a bit unctuous
TOTAL - 4 stars...unique subcontinental dishes well worth trying
author: Ed U.

description: MAN I don't know about the best Indian food in SF but they're up there for sure I can not stress enough with these words how that food made me and my date feel like the food was bomb fresh spicy creamy my tongue remembers every note of this meal definitely not a cheap date I recommend bringing dates here or friends especially good place to share some naan too!!!!
author: Rolin S.

description:
Unpretentious, reasonably priced Indian food in the Mission. The restaurant is bare bones but clean, a couple of tables and booths with paper placemats and bare walls. That's fine cause the food is bomb and the service was very attentive and kind. They also serve the food on metal plates just like in India. Like that the food was not heavy or too greasy and was quite fresh.

Chili Paneer - (3/5) Kinda bland, not spicy enough. This tasted the most guilty fast food like with the cornstarch coating.
Tandoori Chicken (4.5/5) - Very juicy and well marinated and seasoned with an amazing char. The smokiness was a little fruit in nature as if from saffron but I don't believe it was used.
Podi Dosa (5/5) - Amazing texture, a smooth but crispy shell, very interesting spice combinations, properly spicy. Came with three chutneys: the coconut (my fav because it helped cool it down), and sambar.
Ras Malai (3.5/5) - Sugary, rosy spiced with cardamom. The cheese had a great texture of spongey yet firm enough without being tough. The cream it was floating in was grainy and not as smooth, but props for making it in house.

Went again and ordered 2 curries to go on a second occasion which came with a side of rice. I was able to stretch this out to 4 meals but take that with a grain of salt as I'm a smaller person with an healthy appetite.
Saag Paneer (4/5) - Very intense celery smell. Spinach pureed in heavy cream, notably and thankfully absent is cheap greasy oil. Paneer was a great texture, not too firm, not too mushy and mild in flavor.
Butter Chicken (4/5) - Incredible creamy coconut milk based sauce, tender chicken thigh chunks.

Everything tasted great, the curries aren't a huge portion and the protein (paneer, chicken) to sauce ratio is lacking. You should definitely finish all the sauce with whatever vehicle you can - rice, naan.
author: Truc N.

description:
After just getting off a 12 hour plane ride, all I wanted to do was grab a quick dinner somewhere and go straight to bed. We decided to go to Deccan spice and it did the trick! It's a pretty small restaurant so we were immediately greeted by the staff and seated. 

We ordered three dishes: butter chicken, chicken tikka masala, and a veggie tikka masala. We also ordered two orders of naan and extra rice since it doesn't come with enough. That was the only downside of our experience if that says anything. The food was delicious and the portions were pretty average; what you would normally receive at an Indian restaurant. I wouldn't say they were big, but they weren't small either. 

However, for SF the prices here were great! They were actually on the lower end and I was pleasantly surprised since being a visitor, you hear that everything in SF is expensive. For all our food, it came out to about $16 a person which was good for me. Definitely go back next time I'm in the Bay Area!
author: Michelle L.

description:
FOOD: food is solid! I am excited to say they are not kidding about the "Spice" in their name. Everyone in our party asked for food "medium" on a cold day, and we were plenty warm by the end :). One person in party who was not as spice tolerant had to stop eating early... more food for me!
None of the food was a revelation, but I was pleased to have what I thought was quite nice Indian food in the trendier (and consequently sometimes blander) Valencia corridor. Saag Paneer was not too creamy (I prefer it that way), Chicken Korma was enjoyed by fellow diner, and Paneer Tikka had the right balance of salt, sweet, creamy, and tomato. 

Rice is included in the price (hence the slightly higher price)--this is a rarity in SF!

Plain naan was dry and fluffy (as opposed to when it is chewy and a little oily--I appreciate both). Butter naan was that but with some butter on top! Both were made as rounds and split equally into fourths. 

SERVICE: Very friendly! 
I made a reservation through Yelp Res for 11pm (the earliest available... really?), but we were seated at a table at 10:30 (when we arrived). 


AMBIANCE: Nicely decorated, quiet, and great for a casual dining experience. As seating is limited and the door opens quite often, on cold days you may feel a breeze if seated by the door. Difficult to have a very intimate conversation if not at the corner table as it is busy. Decor is modern, though I was a little confused by the empty shelves/frames mounted on the wall that looked like spice racks... might be nice to put something on them!
author: Helen W.

description: One of the worst tikka masalas I've had and the service was terrible. A waiter took our order and the food never came. Then a different waiter came and took our order again. It was the hottest SF weather on record and they would not refill our water. Employees were running in and out constantly with to go orders but seemed like they forgot about the customers eating at the restaurant. They gave us the wrong dessert.
author: Leeyen R.

description:
Not very often Yelp leads us astray but we were totally underwhelmed with our $37 dinner that consist of one entree one app one bread and two drinks. Essentially since I came for dosa- we are sitting at the table nearly 10-15 mins examining the menu , it's early dinner time ...6pm? and the place is deserted, we finally go to order and he says sorry we have no dosa for two hours.... Um what? 

So I get an appetizer tiffin which was two iddili and one vada with some sambar and the standard coconut and other chutneys. The flavors were really good (4.5 stars) but when I asked for a little more sambar I was brought a side and charged two dollars without telling me (1 star!) - I thought that was in poor taste given they had no dosas which make up half the menu...

My husband didn't care for his Chana masala (2 stars), he thought the coconut milk flavor in there was weird- I kinda liked it but there was a ton of almost Raw onions in there. Naan was eh, and way overpriced for the portion (1.5 stars ) the guy brought us free rice it Maybe it came with the curry, rice walls good.

The service was also really weird, like it looks as if they have upgraded the interior but the water glasses are still plastic. We ordered a beer and were only brought a bottle. The vibe was just weird and there was no dosa, whhhhyyyy. What a waste....
author: Coco J.

description: I've eaten 10's of thousands of Indian meals. This was the 2nd worst Indian meal that I've ever had. The worst nearly hospitalized me in Madras. Some highlights: 1) overcooked veggie pakoras that resembled dry cat food, 2) undercooked fish in a runny Hyderabad sauce, 3) mushy malai Kofta in a runny velveta like sauce, 4) roti the consistency of cardboard. Wow! $46 dollars. Wow again! I would have paid $46 to erase that meal.
author: iko o.

description:
My new go-to for uber eats!! We have ordered several times from here and it's always very tasty!

The chicken tikka masala is amazing! It's pretty creamy although it's perfect over rice or with naan. Get it with the garlic and cheese naan and you won't be sorry. This dish is so good that I find myself craving it every week.

The mango lassi, even though it's super expensive, is quite refreshing as well.

The new favorite for my Indian kick. Yummy!
Warning: don't get the chai. It's bland and flavor-less. Just splurge on the lassi.
author: Cicely T.

description:
The quality of food at Deccan isn't really consistent. On some visits the food was amazing and on other occasions the food seemed mediocre.

The service at Deccan Spice varies drastically too. Sometimes they treat you really well and are prompt and courteous in service. Other times the service seems painfully slow and they don't really seem to care for you (which sucks).

Since they vary between 2 and 4 stars, I'm going to average it out to a 3. A-OK.
author: Leelakrishna N.

description:
We use to love this place but the quality has gone down significantly over the last year. We ordered an appetizer, my husband ordered butter chicken and I a Dosa. Anyway, appetizer was ok, rest of the food, horrible. Cold and greasy. We complained to our waitress and she was very nice to take the food back to fix the issue. However, the second time around it was worse. They reheated everything. Who reheats a Dosa?

We asked if the chef had changed and were told no, but then told that the chef had the day off.  Well, the chef was obviously not there and it most certainly came across in the quality of the food. We decided to cancel the order and leave. They were very nice to comp the check. 

Even though the service was great and the staff was very understanding and accommodating, the food was terribly disappointing. We ended up going to Barzotto.
author: Gaurav P.

description: Delicious food and extremely courteous staff !! Must try  Hands down the best Indian food spot for after weekend parties .
author: A G.

description:
Too rainy and there's always an app. Tonight it led us to Deccan Spice.

We've been to India a lot, I lived in Pakistan near Amritsar for a while, and we know this cuisine.

This place rocks.

The idlis, the butter chicken, the saag paneer, the bhaji! Palate pleasing plenty!

Add the fragrant onion kulcha, a forever favorite, and well priced as well.

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description: It is simply not good.  Tasty Bite pouches from the grocery store would actually be preferred.
author: T-Bone L.

description:
Delicious food at a great value with friendly staff. I took out the Mysore Dias and mini Idli. They provided a free soup as well.

Really rich and interesting spices and flavors. It seems like they have an extensive menu with a variety of dosa options. Will definitely come back and try them all.
author: Gabe S.

description:
This was my second time ordering from Deccan Spice and while my first time was amazing (5 stars), I'm sad to say that this experience was very disappointing. 

- CHICKEN VINDALOO: When my husband opened his dish, there was entire layer of oil floating on top of the curry. Not a good sign. He scooped it out so we could have a taste and (1) It was still very oily and very salty, (2) He ordered it spicy and it was very mild, and (3) he always orders vindaloo at Indian restaurants and this did not taste like vindaloo. We're not really sure what it was to be honest. Vindaloo also has a dark red color and this was brown.

- CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA: This curry had about 60% onions and 40% chicken in it. I've never even had tikka masala with onions in it before so this was interesting. I also ordered this dish medium spicy and it was mild and very bland. The curry lacked in flavor. 

Overall, super bummed about what we received. The food was simply not good. Unfortunately we will probably explore other options before coming back here.
author: Chisholm T.

description: This is my favorite biryani spot! I'm from Hyderabad, India, home of the biryani. This place gets it right every single time! :)
author: Utsav D.

description:
We've ordered from this establishment a few times without incident, and really enjoyed the food. But this last time was an exercise in extreme frustration.

We ordered 4 dishes plus sides (chicken tikka masala, veg cashew curry, chana masala, and veg rogan josh). We got TWO chicken tikka, and one rogan josh and all the correct sides.

Called Deccan Spice a few times but got the runaround each time and promises to call back, blaming the driver, blaming everyone else and not accepting responsibility. I know that sometimes people try to get sketchy about orders, but I've ordered several times without incident, and large orders too.

We were really disappointed. We had a vegetarian with us, and they were also stuck because they didn't get their food. We'll be taking our Indian delivery business elsewhere.
author: Bobby C.

description:
Tandoori Chicken ($13): 4 stars
Gongura Goat ($18ish): 4 stars
Rose Milk: 2 stars
Falooda ($8): 1 star
Overall: 3.5 stars rounding it to 4 for customer service

Tandoori chicken was pretty juicy and delicious, spicy but I like it. It was kinda weird that they put hella sauce on top, like a spicy indian bbq sauce. But it worked well and we liked how it's served sizzling hot on a bed of bell peppers! If you're a meat lover, I'd get the sampler ($19) with lamb, chicken, shrimp, etc.. to try it out.

Gongura Goat (ask for less salty!!) came soooo overwhelmingly salty that I could not eat more than one bite. And I really wanted to because the spices were good! We told our server about it and he quickly offered to remake it. When it came back out, it was perfect. Gongura is this leaf that gives off the same taste as marinaded olive leaves (橄藍菜). Waiter told us it's like spinach.. lolll it is not like spinach. But it's good. And spicy. I was pretty blown away by this dish, I'd totally order it again. The goat had some tendons and chewiness which I think worked well with the curry. No gaminess from the meat, they cooked it well.

We also ordered paratha which was more like chapati (thin bread, $4 for two pieces). It was really good but kinda expensive I guess.

The dessert and drinks.. were really disappointing. Falooda had none of the promised vermicelli and stuff. Waiter said it's due to customer complaints that customers wanted those things out. Really now. So it was literally a milkshake.. for $8! They did take it off the bill for us so I'm not gonna complain about it too much, but avoid falooda here! lol. You can get a legitimate indian dessert in the south bay for so much cheaper. Rose milk was aiite. Way too sweet for me, but it balanced out the spiciness of other dishes well.
author: Maggie G.

description:
This is probably the best indian restaurant i had ever visited, late night food with beautiful indian music tasty food with moderate service 
I have ordered Andra chicken curry with garlic naan 
And my friend ordered deccan special biryani
They suprised us by serving the rice  and rasagulla for free and said that it was complementary 
What else i can expect from an indian restaurant 
Guys you were awesome man
author: Naga Vinod C.

description: Ordered vegetable Hydrabadi dum biryani and some appetizers online. Took about an hour to deliver, I live in San Francisco right next to SF State. But the delivery was free so that's good. Going by the reviews, it's nothing as other reviewers are describing it to be. I've had biryani and many locations in the bay area and this one was probably the worst one I've had. Vegetable biryani is straight up saffron colored rice and maybe if you're lucky a couple of small bits of veggies. Flavor is bland and the raita is of poor quality. NO VEGETABLES in the biryani OMG! Did I just pay $10 for a bowl of rice? Check the photo below and decide for yourself. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!
author: Jigar S.

description:
This place is fantastic, food is unbelievably Yummy. The service is 5stars, I had a bd celebration at that place with my classmates and the restaurant administration generously presented a birthday cake wth a "happy birthday" song !!! So sweet!!! Couldn't have asked for more !!! 
The quality of food is fantastic, the manager is just and smiley :) 5 stars to the place!!! Cheers !!!
author: Konstantin I.

description:
Great food. The biriyani is a must have here.

Delivery timing has improved significantly.
author: Rohan A.

description:
The food was good; the service was bumpy. They were busy so I wasn't too surprised that it took a long while to give my order & get refills etc. They forgot to give my card back after paying so I waited another 10-15 mins for that.

It happens, it may have just been an off-night. I'll give it another try because the food was good. I enjoyed the Andhra curry & the prices were reasonable.
author: Paul S.

description: I along with a group of 15 ppl went to this restaurant last night. The owner of the restaurant informed us that it was closing time for the restaurant and the staff was wrapping up and all he could do was to take order for biryanis to-go. However, he accommodated our request to eat at the restaurant., since it was late at night. Not only that, he ensured that the biryani and other food items were delicious and fresh. We really enjoyed the food and the experience. Thank you Prashant (the owner) for the hospitality. Would love to visit again.
author: Yeshika D.

description: Food was amazing especially butter chicken. If you want to try great indian food must try this place. Good service!
author: Leena S.

description: I visited this place on a Saturday after 2 am and was surprised by how friendly and cooperative the entire staff was. Not only they cooked us everything we asked for but the quality of food was as good as any indian restaurant in SF that I have had. Cheers to Kumar and Prashant
author: Varun K.

description: Didn't like the food...mutton smells like its been stored for way to many days..naans are awesome fact to accept...
author: Chandu D.

description:
Great food.  We had the Andhra curry and Mysore Dosa - both nice.  This was my second time here, and I've found that it is consistently good and authentic. 

The curry has the right amount of spice and is flavorful. We like that they offer a wide variety of proteins for all of their curries- not just meats like chicken and even goat, but also vegetarian options like paneer, tofu, and even jackfruit.

The service was good when I was there.

The reviewer who complained about their tea cup being cracked can cry me a river.
author: Jimmy D.

description:
We have pretty much been ordering from here weekly since they opened.  They have such an amazing, diverse menu and everything is just flat out great to epic.  I end up mixing what we order from there with some home dishes for some delicious feasts.

Their standards are all quite good: chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, etc are delish.  I recommend branching out and trying items like the lamb roganjosh, it's a mouth-watering savory delight with tender lamb and a rich sauce.  Their cashew curry has become a staple of mine, it is so creamy and spicy, just an amazing texture and flavor with the soft cashews.  Another go-to item has been the chicken chettinad which is just a solid, hearty chicken curry, just checks all the boxes.  

The only things that I think are just good are their yellow dal (just too watery) and their dosas (always arrive soft and not crisp).  But these are minor imperfections. 

Love this place, so glad they opened one here in SF!
author: Saminda W.

description: The food here is amazing. I ordered the spinach egg saagwala and garlic nan plus I tasted the butter masala with lamb. Mmmm. It's really cozy and clean inside. Plus they are open hella late so you can keep the party going!
author: Jenna Y.

description:
Weird, low, dim, blue lighting so you can't really see what you're eating.
Food mediocre to bad. Ordered the tikka chicken masala and did not enjoy much with a slight stomach ache. There was like 3 pieces of chicken. 
Bf ordered something with lamb and they left the bone in which meant basically all of it was bone and little actual meat. Other people at the table said it was all just okay.

I rarely rate places this badly but I also paid $20 for my entree plus a mango lassi and I realized that this is ridiculous considering how mediocre the food was.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Why does this place have a 4 star rating? I'm not sure. Came here for dinner one night and the lighting was weird and dark and blue... so you can't really see your food.

I made a reservation for this place through Yelp, got a confirmation, and a reminder. Got there.. they were like what are you talking about a reservation?? Luckily, they had room. 

Order the butter chicken and a mango lassi. Dish was alright. Very little meat. I do like that all the dishes automatically come with rice though. Garlic naan was okay. I've had better (like Holy Kitchen). 

Also, they messed up our check and added on an extra beer. Lastly, they added gratuity to our check without even letting us know. I'm pretty sure it didn't say so anywhere in the menu. 

So someone tell me why they have 4 stars? I really don't get it.
author: Julie L.

description:
For my first ever Indian food... 
 I have to say, WOW
I loved it. Although the mild sauce was pretty hot, I loved every single bite of it. So much flavor and FOOD! Definitely have to go back to try other stuff :) 100% recommended but be careful cuz if u don't like hot sauce ooh. Also their ice cream dessert was different lol but it's yummy!
author: Jimbo R.

description: The tikka masala was completely flavorless and the whole wheat naan was dry as powder. I'll stick to Om Indian in Height.
author: Brandon F.

description: I came to this place with my friend. We ordered garlic cheese naan, malai koftha, chicken biryani, gulab jamun. The malai koftha and gulab jamun are good. But my friend told chicken biryani is not as expected and chicken has no flavor in it kinda bland.
author: Mrinalini G.

description:
Deccan Spice is definitely some of the best Indian Food I have had in SF. I have eaten their food twice: Once for delivery when they just opened and recently in their restaurant and both times, I was impressed with the quality and value. Sure, this is no Dosa or Amber in terms of fanciness but you can tell this restaurant is run by people who are passionate about cooking for others and producing satisfying, delicious food.

The time we ordered delivery, it did take us an hour and a half to get our food which we were a bit annoyed with but since they just opened, we understood. When we finally got the food, any annoyance went away just because it was that good. I cannot remember exactly what we ordered but it CAME with rice (not common) and we got a free Chicken Biryani for hitting some delivery order amount.

Remembering how good the food was and craving Indian food, we came in last week for dinner on Saturday around ~9pm. This place was POPPING. The restaurant is small, to be fair, but there was a line that was forming while we were ordering that was a few parties deep. Deccan Spice is apparently open until 3 AM which is AWESOME and I imagine great drunchies. I will have to try that out some time ; ) 

Anyways, for the two of us, we ordered Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Chettinad and 1 Garlic Naan to share. We ordered the dishes "Indian Spicy" and they looked at us like we were nuts but hey, we like our spice and most places DON'T make food spicy enough for me. I also personally had a Madras Coffee and my boyfriend had a Coke. They also have a Yelp Check-In deal for a free soft drink so his drink was free.

We probably waited around 30 minutes for our food which felt like a long time but it was fine. If anything, watching everyone else's food come out made us even more excited. Finally our food arrived and everything was GREAT. Both dishes were PHENOMENAL, especially the Chicken Chettinad. I will say, I think they went a bit easy on the spices but I guess they would rather risk that than a law suit from people who don't realize what they are ordering. It still was spicier than most places will serve us so I was happy. Again, it also came with rice which was really great considering that almost never happens in SF. We immensely enjoyed our meal and felt like it was the right amount of food. The price was right and both of us left with happy bellies. We cannot wait to come back for dinner, late night or even breakfast!
author: Carrie W.

description: Always been a great place to get delivery from. Food is great. Their Biriyanis are so good, very hard to find good biriyanis. Chicken 65 and chicken 555 also awesome. Great spice level... I enjoy it spicy :) Love this place. Never ordered south indian for delivery but definitely will try it sometime soon.
author: T B.

description: Very good South Indian food especially Andhra/Hyderabadi food in the city. They are open late.
author: Andhra Y.

description:
Favorite place to go in the city for Indian food!!! My
Coworkers and I work late so it's a plus that they stay open. So tasteful and so many spices.
author: Brianna S.

description:
Pretty good food. Very close to authenticate Indian taste. Must try it once.

Tried special biryani and gongura curry with chilly naan and cheese & garlic naan.
author: Nilesh S.

description: Ordered chicken rogan josh, curry was spoiled. Malai kofta is full of cream. I would suggest not to go there.
author: Manisha V.

description:
Great Indian food. With a very good service, you will feel like home. 

Look for the Vindaloo ;-)
author: Javier F.

description:
Damn, that was good. I got the Deccan special biryani. It's composed of perfectly cooked saffron biryani, tender/juicy/lightly breaded? chicken in an incredible spicy/rich sauce along with smokey mango chutney, raita, sliced onions, cilantro, and a boiled egg. It was very good and it's one of those things that you just gotta try.

Service was also excellent and the interior has a very simple but regal theme to it. Definitely a place you can take for a date or some special occasion.

5-stars =)
author: Double O S.

description:
I frequently cook Indian food at home--it's my specialty, so when I go out to an Indian restaurant I tend to be a little more picky about the quality. I think this little gem has some of the best Indian food in all of California. It's fresh, affordable, has delicious chutneys and lots of exotic fare. The uttapam was generous and filling. The kofta and Rohan Josh were equally amazing. I highly recommend this place and their lovely, friendly service. A+++

Update: my second time here. Better and better. I fucking love this place.
author: Ryan K.

description:
Delivery only.  Delivered within a few minutes before the promised time.  

Food = good. 

Chicken Tikka Masala = creamy, slightly sweet and smoky. Ordered medium and they brought the heat. $12.00

Chicken 65 = deep fried chicken, very red, and delicious. Full of flavor, moist but wasn't very spicy. $10.00

Saag Paneer = flavorful, and big cubes of paneer. Not too salty. $12.00

Garlic Naan = good. A bit soggy but that's likely from delivery. $4.00

Raita = watery. But did the job for the heat. $2.00

Chicken biryani = full of cardamom flavor.  It comes free with orders over $35.00. 

Prices = moderate. Dinner for two came out to $43.41 with leftovers.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Best Biryani in SF! 

They are friendly and very accommodating. Great experience thus far, keep it up Deccan Spice!!!
author: Srikanth B.

description: This is our neighborhood local - we love it. Samosas, pakora, naan, chicken tikka masala - it is all so good!
author: Mark S. I.

description: I revived my yelp account just to write this review. I'm a gentleman who really takes food seriously. No, not Gordon Ramsey seriously, but if I'm handing you my hard earned cash, then I expect a quality meal. I paid $83 dollars to treat my coworkers to lunch here, and I'm seriously disappointed in the service and quality of the food. And for 20 bucks a person (roughly) I expect to be full. We each ordered the tikka masala. And every bowl was child sized. THIS IS AMERICA! We are big because we eat big! I regret to admit that I forked over the cash anyway. But places like this make me want to protest payment and walk out. Do yourself a favor and eat at the soup kitchen, you'll be better fed. Terrible service. Terrible meal. What the heck am I paying for? You get more food in a happy meal at McDonald's. I hope this place closes and someone with a better business opens up here.
author: Taijan W.

description:
Delivery review:

Tikka masala was super watery more like a soup. Same with the raita. They messed up and gave me roti instead of garlic naan.  Goodbye $2. At least the delivery was quick.
author: Aehrwyn C.

description:
Deccan Spice has amazing food. The "Mutton Biryani" is the best . I have been in more than 23 states and could tell you that its among the top three rankings. The hospitality is great and the staff is amazing. Great service and hospitality with super Taste of food. The reason for amazing rating is "The consistency of the Taste" every time you taste the dish its just perfect.

Rating 5*
author: Ameya P.

description: Food is good but I  don't advise getting  delivery as it is often late.  Also,  they got our order wrong two times on separate occasions, which we forgave because they gave us a refund.  However, tonight we ordered delivery at 6:45 pm, they sent us an email saying order would arrive at 7:45 pm - we waited until 8:15 pm and called.  The person answering the phone said our order had been cancelled because they only had 1 delivery driver.  Okay, that's fair.  But they never notified us,  and we waited around for 1.5 hours for dinner that was never coming.  The lady on the phone wasn't enough even going to tell me at first  why the order was cancelled,  until I inquired and told her that it seems inappropriate to  not notify customers when delivery is cancelled.    Especially because we could have just decided to pick it up had they communicated better.
author: Kim M.

description:
Rarely take the time to bother with reviews, but this was such a uniformly awful delivery experience I felt compelled. After receiving the delivery late, I opened it to find all the containers absolutely soaked in the dipping sauces for the pakora. The pakora itself was pretty dry, maybe could have benefited from some tamarind sauce...

Also ordered some rasam, received a nearly half-full plastic pint container of it. I also received some very oily broth which wasn't part of the order. Not sure where it came from or what it was. Had a spoonful of it and tossed it, though. Far too oily.

The utthapam that was meant to be my entree was a decent size and came with the requested toppings. In short, decent but given the absolute mess the rest of the order was, not terribly satisfying.

Not sure how they do for dine-in service, but would strongly recommend against delivery.
author: Andy E.

description: This place is phenomenal!!! Can't say enough good things about the food and the service. And the fact that it's open in the wee hours of the night - God bless them for feeding the hungry and drunk souls in the middle of the night!
author: Priyanka K.

description:
Their menu reminded me of Godavari, a Hyderabadi restaurant chain that I love... so I gave this place a try. Their extensive menu (verrrry huge selection) did not translate into extensive flavors. All curries tasted almost the same IMO.

However, their Deccan Special Biryani was yummy. Their Indo-Chinese menu was a guilty pleasure.
author: Ram R.

description: I really loved this place initially. But I have ordered 3-4 different times since then and the food is just meh. I think that they probably had very high quality as a new place but it just tastes like all the mediocre Indian food in San Francisco now. Very disappointing.
author: Shruti G.

description:
This had to be the worst food I've ever eaten ever. I ordered take out on Saturday night. Delivery was fast but the food was awful! I ordered tandoori chicken and Chana masala and white rice. The chicken was so dry and tasted old. It was a small portion too. I think it was left overs from weeks ago. The rice also tasted old and was dry. The Chana masala was also weird tasting and the sauce was a weird consistency. Probably old too... also pretty expensive for the amount and quality of the food. 

I was so disappointed and surprised that a restaurant can actually send food out like that. 

I never even right reviews but this was something I had to share. 

I wanted to update the review.... the owner reached out to me to apologize and actually delivered food without any notification which was a nice surprise! The food was really good! Very fresh and tasty! 

I think the  incident was a one time thing.  And I would totally give it another chance!
author: Eva A.

description:
For so long, years, I was in a relationship with Dosa on Valencia.

Then, Deccan came into my life. And for delivery, I'm all about this joint now. For a nice brunch, mama is still excusice with Dosa, IJS.

Dosa sandwich. Mauf broke.

Schezwan gobi. Damnnnnnn. Perfection.

Saag paneer? That paneer is cream-eeeee and soft, and the saag is smooooth goodness. Medium spicy? Mama is all about it.

The one thing they drop the ball on? The daal. It's been runny a couple of times, lacks that punch I need in my daal. Disappointing.

The rest tho, gahhhhhh, give it to me now!
author: Gabriela W.

description: I think if I could only order and eat one thing for the rest of my life, it would be the the Chicken Tikka Masala over here. The curry had the right consistency to me and wasn't watery and wasn't too spicy nor mild either. Just right. Good amount and good sized pieces of chicken in the order also. The orders arrived relatively quickly and the wait staff here were attentive and friendly. The Naan over here tasted very fresh.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Asked for mild and my food came with red chilies all in it. Dipped a pinkie in to test it, and it's way too hot for me to eat.  They also included a different dish I never ordered and forgot the other one I DID order. 

Since I got this delivery and, didn't untie and open the bag until I was inside and the delivery guy was gone, there's zero point in trying to get this fixed. 

So, one inedible dish, and one that is something that I didn't order, and which is also swimming with chilies.

The ONE thing they got right was onion naan.

A huge waste of time and money.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Thoroughly enjoyable lunch with many options to choose from. Kind and patient wait staff. Delicious food. 

Looked like a new spot in the neighborhood and decided to give it a try. Less expensive than Dosa, and a lot cleaner than Udupi Palace.

I mistook "V" to mean the dish was vegan, and when it arrived, it had dairy all over it. They took it away and suggested two other dishes I could choose from. Then after a moment they came back and said the kitchen could make our original dish into dairy free. It came fairly soon after and was delicious. 

I was never charged for the mistaken dish (my mistake) and thought the prices were very reasonable. 

Would definitely return.
author: Ali H.

description:
Disclaimer: I am 100% Telugu from Hyderabad, grew up on my family+ Paradise biryani.

Biryani was alright, I would describe it as a reasonably authentic Andhra biryani with a fair amount of spice. However,
- Tiny portions for the price. Really small, barely enough for one person with a small appetite. 
- The Salan is a ruse. Not exactly sure what the gravy like substance is supposed to be.
- Chicken 65 is not at all authentic.
- Still better than a lot of Indian restaurants in the city though.
author: Roshan G.

description:
Ordered delivery through Uber Eats when they had a $20 off coupon code for new users.

We ordered Chicken 65, Chicken tikka masala, samosas and garlic naan.

Initial impression: delivery portions are tiny! Both of the curries came in a small take out container that looked like it could've been the size of a TV dinner. Each curry was $11-15 and we're in SF though, so I don't know why I was surprised.

I've had Chicken 65 before so I wasn't surprised but my husband was thrown off by the bright red color. It had good flavor and a lot of heat! I would recommend getting some raita or something neutral to help cool the spiciness of it.

Chicken tikka masala was good.

Overall, decent Indian food. I would probably order again but would order double servings next time since the portions are small. Seems to be a better value than Amber, which had tiny ass small portions and was twice as expensive as Deccan Spice.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Butter chicken is amazing! Great service and they deliver!
This is my go to for a Saturday night in with a bottle of wine :)
author: Jessica T.

description: Amazing service and proper good South Indian food. Came with 2 of my Indian friends and they couldn't stop talking about this place for a while. Be ready for the extreme spice level though
author: Gözde G.

description: Came here for food at 2am after a night of drinking. Everything we ordered tasted pretty good except for the tandoori chicken which was rock hard. The naans were super soft and tasted awesome with the chicken Manchurian. My friend had the ghee roast and said it was amazing. It stays open till 3am!! So that's definitely a win!
author: Ahana D.

description:
Excellent new South Indian restaurant on Valencia St. I'd heard about this place opening, and had been meaning to check it out. Finally got a chance to do so today. This is my favorite of the three South Indian restaurants on these couple of blocks of Valencia Street.

I particularly enjoyed the chicken 65 and the madras coffee.

I'm sad to be moving out of the mission soon after calling it my home for 5 years. I'll definitely make a point of stopping by Deccan Spice when I come back to visit!
author: Muhammad H.

description:
Yum, yum, yum.  Ordered Naan, Pakora, Ch. Tandoor, Hyderabadi Koorma and it was delivered very quickly and everything was hot and absolutely delicious (altho I think the
Hyderabadi Koorma was actually Gulab Jamun). We really loved the dishes and it was
difficult to pick them among the great menu with described ingredients for each.  They
even threw in a (very small) container of white rice which was super for pouring the sauces over (bigger container next time guys).  All-in-all a great meal and definitely will order
again.
author: William G.

description: This is definitely not one of my favorites. As soon as we got our food we put a spoon in it and there was a hair. We let that slide but then the guy didn't want to give us two bowls for sambar so he just gave us one big bowl. As soon as my mom got her food there was another hair. After that I lost my appetite. The Pakoras were burnt, we had to ask them for chutney and when we got it we only had about half a spoon of chutney. We had to wait so long for our food even though the place was empty. Yelp is nice they won't let us give zero stars. Do not come to this place.
author: Arin K.

description: Very bad food and food is not safety. I ordered for a chicken biriyani. They gave me cold it was not properly cooked.
author: Vikram R.

description:
I'm not sure what the hype is about. We opted for South Indian, as it's less common in SF. The Idly Vada Combo (two idly, one vada) delivered on expectations. I ordered the Spring Dosa but after some confusion I realized they gave me the Sandwich Dosa, which I was not a fan of and ate less than half. I didn't enjoy the cheese; it was more like eating a pizza than a dosa. The Mysore Dosa was much better, although the dosa to filling ratio was disappointing. We rounded out the meal with chai and gulab jamun, which were both good. 

Definitely no points for ambiance, as the small room is uncomfortably cramped, especially with those eagerly awaiting a table and squeezing through to the back to put their name down. I'd try takeout instead.
author: Cristina S.

description: This is my favorite place to eat after job, My partner and i really love the tika Masala and mango lasy. Excellent Indian food :D
author: Jorge C.

description:
Just had dinner here and this is now my #1 spot for Butter Chicken. We also had vegetarian samosas, garlic naan, and Goan fish curry. All of the dishes came out hot and flavorful, but the highlight was the Butter Chicken... in addition to the creaminess, it had a sweetness to it that I haven't had before. The entrees could be a little bigger to correspond with the price point.

The restaurant is on the small side and there is not much decor. There was a steady stream of people during the dinner hour. The staff was friendly, but as it got busier we had to flag down the staff.
author: Josh L.

description:
Even though I am a frenetic Yelp user, I don't usually write reviews. I feel it takes a lot of effort to sit down on a computer or use my smartphone keyboard to provide insights on a restaurant. But Deccan Spice is my first, and this is by far the best Indian food I've had in the city. 

I am a huge fan of butter chicken and literally tried 10 different restaurants around the bay, Deccan Spice just makes it better. Perfect creaminess, the right amount of spices... 
The garlic naan is beautifully crispy, tender in the middle, buttery and seasoned to perfection. 

I am now in the process of exploring the whole menu, and each new item I get to try is just an incredible discovery. I am not gonna list them all here, but just so you know the Deccan Spice special Byriani is one of the best dishes I've had in a very long time. Juicy chicken, amazing flavors in the sauce, an egg that brings a great softness to it. 

To be honest, I am not sure if I'll have the drive to leave a review again, but I could write hundreds of reviews for the sake of this beautiful little Indian joint on 22nd and Valencia. 

Don't sleep on this !!!
author: Raphael L.

description:
If you want amazing Indian food, this is the place. The taste is authentic, food is not heavy / oily and the quality and quantity of food is awesome. We ordered Samosas, medu wada, uttapam and schezwan chicken for appetizers. The main course was the special biryani, goat biryani, 2 naans and chettinadu chicken. We asked for spicy food and we got spicy food. 

The place is small so might not be great for groups. Also open really late so if you are craving Indian food at night, hit this place up.
author: Hirubhai A.

description:
Worst dining experience of my life .
Terrible food . Even worse service . 
After sharing my thoughts with management no one cared .
author: Susan L.

description:
My first time to try Indian food. And I do love it. Garlic naan is the best. 

I had dessert that called "Guleb Jamum" It came with syrup. For me, it was too sweet but It has something that small good :) 

I will come back and try others food. I would recommend this place.
author: Pinarat S.

description:
My review of the online order placed to Deccan Spice a few weeks ago...

Their plain naan bread is very delicious btw!!! Could taste the butter in it.. Still was soft even after reheating in the microwave.

Lamb Vindaloo is great,probably the best I've had so far and I've tried many an Indian place all around the bay. Very spicy but the heat is tolerable. Right amount of spice to give you a little fire kick on your tongue,but not too much to the point it is unbearable. Beware their vindaloo spices will make your nose run. Wish it was a bigger serving though,seemed a little skimp tbh,but the potatoes in it were the best part of it actually. I would definitely order again for myself and my friends.
author: Isabella A.

description: Just picked up an order for two chicken tikka massalas. Worst I have ever tried in SF. Consistently  is off and it looks and tastes like nacho cheese. WTF. Chicken is cooked poorly. I want my money back!!
author: Fayte T.

description: I have finally found a place in SF to eat good South Indian food ! Starting from crisp vadai , fluffy onion uthappam to mildly flavored dum briyani.. it is not overpriced and ones doesn't go into food coma after indulging in good food !
author: Yuva m.

description:
The food is amazing here.  It's a casual, small space, but the food blew my mind.  If you can't handle spice, steer clear because the food is definitely got some heat.  I usually can't eat too much spice, but the food was SO GOOD, I could not stop eating it!

My husband is South Indian and this is our new favorite Indian restaurant.  The Vada (a savory donut that comes with a spice soup for dipping and two sauces) is the best we've had outside of Bangalore.  

The chicken biryani is so fluffy and flavorful.  We've had it sit down and via take out.  It is much better in the restaurant and comes with a gravy and a yogurt.  The gravy makes it extra delicious and the yogurt helps with cooling off from the spices.

We also love the chicken 65.  It's just super flavorful!  It's as good in the restaurant as with take out.

It's not a fancy ambience (like Dosa), but the food is super delicious and more authentic!
author: Kathryn C.

description:
I was looking forward to trying the chicken biriyani after I had my first biriyani experience in the South Bay recently. I ordered the Chicken Dum Biriyani ($12). It's not explained well in the menu but the Chicken Dum Biriyani is around 4 pieces of cut up chicken, bones and all, vs the Deccan Special Biriyani which has boneless cubes of chicken along with bonus items.

I was shocked when my friends podi dosa came out and the little girl at the next table nearly feel out of the booth when she saw it. It's like a 2 foot long dosa. Then came my biriyani which was gigantic. I wasn't sure if I could eat half. Well, since the chicken had bones in it the dish wasn't as dense as I thought. The chicken was flavorful and so was the rice. I didn't think it was as well done as places in the South Bay, nor was it as spicy hot. But still I was pretty satisfied.

I ended up packing up more than half of it to take home.
author: Jean K.

description: Deccan spice is like a magic 8 ball. You need to be lucky get the best out of them and trust me it doesn't happen often. The randomness applies to not just the quality but quantity and delivery as well. On one of those lucky days, their biryani is good but the best dish I have eaten here is the lamb chops (must eat).
author: Vinay V.

description:
We went here a few months ago when they had just opened. While the service was good. The food basically sucked. 

The dosas were cold and the sambar was tasteless. I am giving 1 star only for the fact they got the dosa round. 

Extremely disappointing food
author: Milana R.

description: I ordered Hyderabadi korma curry spicy, it was not spicy at all. I ordered 2 sprite can soda. They charged me $4 for 2 can soda but they didn't give me the soda. I asked delivery guy, he said he didn't have it. I would never order food from this restaurant again.
author: T B.

description: The best biryani in SF but the worst delivery service in SF as well! They take more than 70 mins to deliver 9 out of 10 times even though it says under 60 mins Everytime.
author: Abdul K.

description:
Zero service, no ice in the restaurant, AC not working. Food mediocre.
Eat elsewhere without melting in heat.
author: Sun R.

description: Really good food have ordered 3 times ! Daal is nice and the fact they serve fresh rotis ! Simple Indian mom cook food
author: Daisy B.

description:
Excellent prices, large portions, and attentive service.
Will definitely recommend for dinner and the location is convenient from either 24th Mission BART or 16th Mission BART.
author: Kris R.

description:
The food was delicious. Its awesome that you can get basically any dish with vegetarian options (jackfruit, pineapple, paneer, tofu, mushrooms).
