I got butter masala with mushrooms, spicy. The spice didn't overpower the flavors, which were delicious. 

The service was also very nice. I felt welcomed when I walked in and the waitress was very accomodating.
author: Zachary G.

description:
Ammmmmazing food great customer service!!
Great portion size, my go to place for indian food now
author: Nivedita L.

description:
Ordered through Uber Eats. No problems but wished there was an option to select spice level. 

Got the Saag Paneer, Garlic Naan, Lamb Dun Biriyani. 
-Saag Paneer: it's solid. Good but have had more flavorful ones elsewhere. 
-Garlic Naan: Good flavor but it was too crispy for me. But I also like naan that is more "doughy" / "bready" with nooks in them
-Lamb Dun Biriyani: Really tasty, lots of flavor and lamb was super tender. Would order again.

Would definitely order again to try other items on the menu
author: H N.

description: Loved the late night Indian food. The snacks are great and filling. Would come back if I am in the area.
author: Subu K.

description:
Very solid new Indian option on Valencia. It's a bit small so it can feel oppressive, but the staff were extremely friendly to make up for it.

Didn't see much value in the dinner specials, so we opted for saag paneer, lamb korma, rice and naan. It was plenty of food for two. Oh, and mango lassi. Everything was spot on -- especially the korma, which was our favorite.

Would definitely come back to explore more of the menu!
author: Ilario H.

description:
We've been ordering food to go from here via Eat24 for several months. Today our experience was so bad, we're wondering if the ownership has changed (it's been a couple of months since we've ordered from them)

First, the food took more than 90 minutes to get here. That would have been OK, but it was also cold. Second, we ordered two Chicken Tikka Masalas, but at different spicy levels. I was very surprised that they couldn't be bothered to mark which was medium and which was extra spicy. Third, the meat seemed like it was lower quality (was it even white meat?) than it was the last time we ordered the same dish. Meh.

It doesn't seem like it's even the same restaurant. We're moving on to a different Indian restaurant and they've lost a long-time customer. In my experience, there are way too many better Indian places to ever risk this level of bad service and poor quality again.
author: Adam N.

description:
We ordered the tandoori chicken, chicken tikka masala, plain naan and pickles. Not sure if they were just having an off day (it was the day after New Years), but we were disappointed with the quality of the food.

The tandoori chicken only came with chicken legs (no thighs or breast meat) and the tandoori paste still had a pasty texture and lacked the full tandoori oven appeal.

The chicken tikka masala was incredibly bland, even though we ordered it spicy, and was subpar relative to places like Lahore karahi, biryani (in east bay), shalimar, New Delhi and a host of other local places.

The naan was pretty good though.
author: E-dough R.

description: I wish If I could give them Negative Stars. Lately I've had tremendous issues with this restaurant. I got a call from owner, who showed humble response on my previous review. Somehow I started trusting again on this restaurant, and Ordered Veggie Biryani tray for my friend's Surprise party. I've a video of that biryani tray which i got, it barely had any veggies in it. It was more like Plain Rice Tray. Owner of this restaurant gave me his personal contact number, if I face any issues in future. Believe me, I sent the video to the owner, but unfortunately I didn't get a response back from him. Money sometimes doesn't matter but some special occasions do, which this restaurant ruined that night. I hope owner of this restaurant would understand.
author: Puneet C.

description: Getting worse day by day. Staff is not that much friendly. Just want to finish the job as soon as possible. Delivered stale biryani. I understand you opened the restaurant for earning money but that does not mean deliver the left over food.
author: Harshit J.

description: Pretty upset with the delivery I just received. We ordered everything mild and I can't event feel my tongue its so spicy. Would not recommend.
author: Heidi L.

description: Deccan spice is mine and my husband's all time favorite .. food here is amazing !! I am from South India and I can tell the quality and taste matches the food from where I come...!! I love the biryani they serve .. !! My five star is for ambiance, food and service !! I was with my friends for lunch here and it was fun !!
author: Roshni G.

description: This has become my go to place for late night desi  food affair. I just had saag and samosa chat and it was wonderful! The guys that work here are considerate and the service is fast! I found the place neat and clean and portions were perfect. What else can you expect from $15 per person dinner ? So go and try that saag!
author: Mudit D.

description: I really want to like their food. Only if they would deliver it. It's been almost two hours since I placed my order. Where is my delivery?
author: Neha H.

description:
I've ordered 5/6 times from here due to proximity. Terrible and hear me out. I genuinely want to support this place but I cannot in good conscience. I am leaving this review so the owners/managers can be aware of their lack of customer service skills and the disorder within their restaurant, especially during dinner. There's been an issue almost every time.

Cons: 
---first time they majorly messed up it was a FOUR HOUR ordeal. The food arrived 1.5 hrs later after several back and forth interactions, and it wasn't the right one and the bread was burnt. Went back and forth several times with them until another order came 4 hrs after the original order. Bread was burned and it was past dinner time. Bread is $4 and we had ordered 4/5. No one ate it so it went to waste. They were semi accusatory as they claimed the order was indeed what we had ordered. 
---second time they super messed up, they flat out said the order wasn't wrong so basically I'm lying. As someone who has eaten chicken tikka masala over 100 times in my life, and several times at this place, I'm certain I received the wrong order. He told me he'd call me back and 25 mins later after I called him back he said he was reviewing the tapes to see if I got the right order. This is after being tossed on the phone from person to person many times. At this point it was almost 2 hrs after the food was ordered. I doubt there will be a refund. 
---inconsistent taste for same dishes. Sometimes watery and sometimes not. 
---bread is either soggy or burnt. Pick your poison. 
---food was delicious the first time and that was on a slow period so you as the customer have to calculate if they're busy and check every item (bc they will leave things out or give you the wrong order and claim you're lying) AND have change (one time the guy didn't have change and was going to leave with an insane tip if I didn't have cash in my change jar).
---they were nice in person one time during pick-up. We thought pickup would avoid wrong order issues. The food was great the first time so we though perhaps we caught them at a couple of off nights; they forgot to include onions and the bread was semi burnt. 
---my theory is they're understaffed, growing and expanding but unsure how to handle it. They mean well I'm sure but they should not treat their customers in this abominable way. 

They've wasted HOURS of my life I want back; it's like a full work day at this point if you add the hours. STAY AWAY, NO FOOD IS WORTH ALL OF THIS!
author: NewtoIthaca N.

description: Great food amazing place! Indian food at its authentic best! The place always smells delicious and the entrees come with rice! I tried the Deccan special biryani and I just loved it! It's really flavorful. I highly recommend Deccan spice to friends
author: Brendon J.

description:
I would not recommend ordering take-out from this restaurant. 

This has been the worst online ordering experience I have ever had with Yelp. When I placed my order, I was quoted 45-60 minutes, which was fine. However, it's now been over 2 hours and 45 minutes and they have still not arrived.

After 1.5 hours, I contacted Eat24 and they said the order would be "delivered soon." 

After 2 hours, I contacted the restaurant, and they said the order had left the restaurant and was "on the way." 

This restaurant is only a 10 minute drive from my home, so they had definitely lied, because it's now been 3 hours and they are still not here. 

I'm extremely disappointed.
author: Jenny F.

description:
Overpriced, murky codswallop. Only in mystical, magical San Francisco.

I got the tandoori prawns (more like tandoori plankton) - $16.
I got the lamb chops - $19. The lamb chops had some sort of sauce on them that made them super mushy and hot.
The naan barely covered my hand. Funnily enough, it was the best tasting part of the meal.

Oh, for future reference:

Mild = hot.
Medium = 2nd degree burns in the roof of your mouth.
Spicy = eat a bowl of lava.

The worst Indian food I've eaten in well over a decade. And I've eaten a lot of Indian food.

4 stars? I'm surprised they get 4/10 of a star.
author: Malcolm M.

description: This place is a fail. The garlic naan was pretty good - but the butter chicken and saag paneer were clearly made by someone who didn't know what they were doing. The Dahi batata puri was a 5 on 10.
author: Ninad A.

description: Started with their varied starwberry lassi and lamb chops and ended with rasamalai all were good and worth for money and time really great food they have ever now
author: Carlos G.

description: Loved the food at Deccan spice! Best part is it's open until 3 am. The Lolly lolly curry was really different and nice!
author: Balaji S.

description:
Ordered takeout around 10pm Wednesday using Yelp. Before we left to make the short trek to Deccan, we received an email that our order would take 10 extra minutes, totally fine.

We get back to our apartment, food in hand. Discovered the dishes are pretty tiny for what you pay for, fine, it's SF. However:
1) The $19 Special Tandoor plate - the menu listed the dish containing red onions, and paneer, which were not present.
2) Also ordered for dessert the Double Ka Meeta, but once we got home, realized they gave us Gulab Jamun.

 I called to let them know about these two things. They told me that their menu was wrong, and that the tandoor plate does not come with paneer. They also told me they are not carrying the Ka Meeta at this time, so they gave us the Galub Jamun.

- please update your menu
- let us know when we come to pick the food up that you don't have a dish. Don't charge us for the more expensive item that you don't have, and give us the cheaper item without any heads up

I will not return, and do not recommend.
author: Shaina J.

description: This place is decent at best.  I'd recommend takeout or delivery since it's not that nice.  I ordered takeout and got the butter masala with chicken and a side of rice.  It was ready quickly and hot when I arrived.  It wasn't that expensive for SF standards but the masala was kind of skimpy on the chicken with a higher proportion of sauce and it wasn't a big container.  I thought the flavor was just ok but it was kind of spicy which I did like.  Overall not a good value and I'll try other nearby Indian places before I consider coming back.
author: george c.

description: Thank you delivery food gods! It's hard to find a decent place that delivers after midnight on a Sunday, but thank goodness this place was open. It was worth the 45 min wait! My friend ordered us some delicious eats of a vegan soup, flat bread, basmanti rice, samosas, (one order is two samosas, FYI, we wish we had placed two orders), and some Chicken 555 for her. Food was nice and hot, bursting with flavor, and warmed our bellies to bliss. I will definitely be adventuring to this place to eat in house!
author: Alicia F.

description:
I would never order from here anymore! By looking at so many reviews and ratings I thought I would give it a try but turned out to be awful!
We have ordered chicken biryani, samosa and gobi manchuriya which tastes like crap(seriously). 

What ever reviews that are already in place might be old ones but as of today it is the worst order ever! 

For the price that they are charging quantity is way too less (I am fine with it as the restaurent being located in san francisco I understand the cost of survival for businesses) but the taste of food is worst!

Guys don't call these things as authentic biryani or indian food, please!
author: Sai K.

description:
Dazed and confused kinda restaurant. 

Glasses of water served... glasses not properly clean. 

Sambar- Andra style was very delicious. 
Vada was ok but very heavy. 
Onion kulcha was was a naan stuffed with raw onions - very inedible. 
Yellow daal was mushy. 
Fish tandoori tasted ok but was over cooked. 

Serious indigestion and acidity all night. I won't be going back here.
author: noflaps c.

description: Worst food. Rancid and staLe. Chicken biryani is fake chicken biryani but they will he left overs of other chicken appetizers example chicken manchurian. So much for money! Karma is a bitch tho!
author: Viren S.

description: I don't think this place should be highly rated as a delivery option. I ordered 3 different dishes, and they all were just a bowl of orange creamy sauce without any meat. Don't waste your money!
author: Joan D.

description:
Easily one of the best Indian restaurants in SF. We have tried the chili paneer, Schezwan cauliflower, cauliflower manchurian, egg biryani, vegetable dum biryani, paneer butter masala, naan, and tandoori paneer tikka (spread over three visits) so far, and they have all been delicious!

If you're a fan of naan, do yourself a giant favor and order a chilly naan with paneer tikka masala; thank me later.

Qualty (and authentic) food, excellent service, friendly staff, modest prices.
author: Divya R.

description: The food was so yummy! They even delivered it to us at 1:30am. It felt fresh & it was flavorful. The man delivering the food was also very kind. Thank you Deccan Spice for saving us on a Sunday nite/Monday morning! :-)
author: Candice N.

description:
Like many other reviewers, I also had high hopes for this place. The food is ok. Comparable to Udupi but not Dosa standards. Maybe it's better for curry, naans and other northern indian fare but I had south indian dosa, idly and vada and the food is decent but not amazing and the service is decidedly poor and rough around the edges. 

Advice to management: Please hire good waitstaff who know what they are doing, are polite, courteous and talk about the menu with some knowledge. Otherwise, you just won't make it on Valencia for long. It's too damn competitive and there are too many great choices.
author: Hema P.

description: We were going to go to Dosa. But they were giving us a hard time about the seating so we decided to try Deccan Spice. And we are so glad we did because they've got the best butter chicken masala I've ever had. We also had the paneer koorma, goat gongura curry and garlic naan. Everything was excellent and tasted authentic. We will definitely be back!
author: Feny G.

description: We've always ordered tons of Indian food but now that we've eliminated meat and drastically cut back on seafood, choices we're getting limited to protein choices of paneer or tofu. We decided to try Deccan Spice and I couldn't believe that every dish allows you to pick the protein (or even mushrooms or pineapple). Usually, it's hard to find a dish like vindaloo that doesn't include meat. The biggest highlight for me is the ability to add JACKFRUIT to any dish! We were so excited to have a new protein option, other than tofu, that wasn't an animal product. Also, being able to have any dish turned into a mushroom dish is a great way to vary our dishes. We'll definitely be ordering from them again!!
author: Fifi M.

description: Big fan of Indian food, needed to get some food to go, came here while my friends are next door. Ordered some food and a glass of wine while I waited, wine did not come till a few minutes before my food did - which took 15 minutes (ordered soup & samosa) when I got the food decided to try a bite of the samosa, which was amazing, yet cold, which was a bummer. Went on to try the soup - had to return it due to the fact it tasted like water. I am a server - have been for years and am not a fan of bad yelp reviews however, a little dissapointed
author: Sam L.

description:
First things first, the food here is the realest. 

We got one order of the Mini Ghee Idli-12 Pieces, one Paneer Tikka Masala, Naan, rice and raita. The food was all very good. Super flavorful, and not overly spicy, so you won't miss out on the experience if you don't enjoy spicy food as is the case unfortunately at some Indian restaurants.  The idli dish was VERY rich, so it was quite filling, but it was so good we completely finished the whole thing. We were so full we had to take some of the Paneer Tikka Masala back home, and my friend who considers himself a bit of a connoisseur of Paneer Tikka Masala in SF agreed when I told him it was one of the best in the city.

The physical location is a little cramped, and definitely a no frills kind of place, but if you're looking for great flavors and homey Indian food, this is a great spot! 

PS. I love that there's a little cluster of Indian restaurants (Dosa, Udupi, Deccan Spice, Aslam's Rasoi) within a few blocks. They each offer something slightly different, but very good!
author: Malika R.

description:
The food was delivered in 75 minutes!!
The chicken tikka masal was super sweet not appetizing at all.. the biryani was just okay & the malai kofta was too oily.
Would not like to order again !
author: Megha L.

description: Just had goat biryani at Deccan spice, felt the authentic flavors in my mouth. Hmmmm the mango lassi was too damm good... the service was real quick. Only thing I advice - please put some ventilation.
author: Pratap G.

description: Only one south indian serving resturant in sf, the dum biryani and mysore masala dosa was very testfull. I suggest this place for late night takeout and delevery. I love this small food temple
author: Prasanna K.

description: Love this place! Extremely flavorful and delicious. When they say spice, they meeeeean spice. Very friendly staff and inviting space. The food speaks for itself.
author: Torrey P.

description: The quantity of food is not sufficient. After consulting with the owner of Deccan Spice, I had placed an order for 120 people. The food wasn't sufficient for even 80 people. We ordered for some more food, which we were told would suffice, however that wasn't sufficient either. Apart from the quantity, the quality of food can be improved to a great measure. During my visit to the restaurant, I was served stale food. They didn't even bother to heat it enough for making it edible at the least. Wouldn't recommend anyone to go to this place. There's a great variety of better places for biryani and/or Indian food in San Francisco.
author: Madhura P.

description: Deccan Spice was delicious. My friend had Biriyani and I had Uthappam with cashews. We ended sharing both dishes as they were delicious. The sauces were also flavorful and spicy. I will be back
author: Elise C.

description:
My partner and I were looking forward to this place but it served the worst Indian food that we have ever had in our lives. 

We had the chili chicken, Andhra Lamb, and Chicken Chettinad. Their online menu describes the chili chicken as "Stir Fried Onion, Tomato & Boiled Chicken Finished with Chili and Curry Leaves". The dish did not come with chilis but instead green bell pepper. 

The Andhra Lamb and Chicken Chettinad were bland and the gravies tasted exactly the same. Also, the gravies were not spicy at all.  

We wanted to order fish curries but they only use salmon for their curries. Most Indian places normally use king fish or pomfrets or if limited on supply, tilapia. We also noticed that they burned the neighboring table's Dosa. 

There is nothing wrong with fusion food (esp. if it is tasty) but this place Americanized their ingredients and dishes. In a very bad way. They removed all of the spice and flavor of Indian food. 

My message to the restaurant: have more faith in your customer's ability to handle the spiciness of Indian food.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Biryani and curry was really great. Chicken 65 was a little too spicy for me.

Pretty good for late night munchies!
author: Pranav B.

description: I tried samosa chat and masala tea. I liked samosa chat - good taste and quantity. I am giving 1 star less as I was not very happy with tea, I wish it was more strong and served hot ( it was kind of warm)
author: Gayatri P.

description: Just ordered delivery from here. I'm a single guy who orders takeout every night. This was the worst hands down. Although it was quick, it was cold and utterly tasteless. I have no idea how they stay in business other than being open late.
author: Cliff H.

description:
I have been to this place multiple times. Food is good. I liked their goat biryani a lot. It comes with flavored basmati rice, delicious gravy and goat pieces which are cooked perfectly. Chicken biryani was okay. 

The thing which I didn't like about this place is stinking smell at the restaurant. It smells as if they soaked walls with rain water for a while and didn't dry it forever.
author: Subba R.

description: Had one of the best golgappe in the area. Really like the water which they serve with golgappe. Egg Biryani along with the Sweet Lassi was really good too. Loved the food here.
author: Arjun V.

description:
I have eaten here a couple of times. The food is adequate if generic Indian. The service is the sort of too-solicitous hovering that gets on my nerves. It's decent value for the money, and I could well have become a regular.  But I won't be going back, because these jerks just sent me text spam.

I never gave them my phone number, so I'm not sure how I got on this list. But I'm sure that I don't want to reward their behavior, so I'll keep giving my business to Dosa, Udupi Palace, and Aslam's Rasoi. The food is as good or better, and none of them have woken me up on Saturday morning with an ad.
author: William P.

description:
I've been coming since this place opened. It replaced my favorite Columbian restaurant but I welcome it. The service is one of the friendliest I've seen. I went here with a friend and once she mentioned it was too spice offhand to me one of the servers brought her a dessert to ease her food. 

I ve only had a few items but the butter chicken hits the spot. The portions are smaller than other places in Mission but I don't mind since the quality makes up for it.
author: Davis N.

description:
I'm enthusiastic about this place for delivery. The food is all very nicely spiced, lots of complexity and flavor and not simplified like so much local Indian. And it's nice to see a menu with some diversity of Indian food, particularly south Indian. I don't just mean idlies and dosas, as good as those are. But Chettinad, Hyderabadi, etc. The Gongura was great. My only complaint is the bread; the naan was weirdly fluffy and the plain roti was too chewy. But the biryani makes up for it.

Folks on Yelp have complained about delivery consistency. I did have a dish missing once, and a slightly awkward jumble in one bag but fortunately the lids held.
author: Nelson M.

description: Where to start? Obviously with the saag, which was some of the nastier food I've ever eaten. They also were out of one item for our delivery order and substituted with another item that we had already ordered. Lame. Several items were requested to be very mild because children would be eating it, but  they turned out to be spicy even for the spicy food lovers. They also got other items in the order wrong. Finally, nothing about the meal was actually very good, although aside from the saag it was edible.
author: K B.

description: We got to Deccan early, and the friendly staff sat our group tight away. They were totally nice about it. The food was really good, service incredible, a good experience all around. I'll go back!
author: Jeffrey B.

description:
Tiny place, but amazing food.  Extremely accommodating and friendly staff, absolutely stunning food, packed with flavor.  Ok, so I stole those zingers from Gordon Ramsay.

Still, great value and guaranteed to leave satisfied.  Only issue is parking around the area, which is tighter than OJ's gloves.
author: Nick L.

description:
An overrated south indian food, the reason I called it a south indian food coz we ordered north indian dish and it tasted horrible.

$3 roti is not worth it at all. It should be a $1. Dont order north indian food from here, this place has alright south indian food. Also, expect a wait, this place takes 30-40 mins for a simple order.

We ordered a dosa, hyderabadi chicken with roti and chole bathura. It took them 40 mins to serve them. Dosa and Hyderabadi chicken were ok. Chole Bathura was a waste of money. Roti was a rip off.

Wont come back and wont recommend. Try other Indian places in mission, they are much better. 

A message to management, stick to the roots dont make the menu huge, stick to what you make good.
author: Sahil B.

description:
Took them three hours to not deliver food. 

Repeatedly said the food was out for delivery.  Eventually called and got a refund.

Maybe the food is great. They were genuinely busy. Bad, hangry experience.


EDIT: Owner called and apologized that night. Took full ownership for the delivery and offered to send out the same meal tonight, for free.

Got the food as promised, plus an extra container of rice and a cup of strawberry lassi.

All good. Can see why people particularly dig the garlic naan, tikka massala and lassi. The saag paneer was a little salty, but was still solid. Didn't order the lassi but def reminded me to get them for dessert more often. Dekka's is thick and tasty, like a fancy Gogurt.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Hit or miss every time. Ordered from here last night and the naan tasted like/had the texture of pita.
author: Cary G.

description: Thank you God! So glad this place from New Jersey and Chicago opened in my hood. Good menu, the butter chicken and the daal fry are some of the most amazing Indian I've had. it all tasted great. Sandeep is the best waiter ever! The music is amazing. Runnnnn here! Best since Guddu's.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Pretty authentic Indian food. Came here the first time by accident, but liked the food so much that we kept going back. The uthappam with onion, chilli, tomato and carrot is mind blowing, cant get enough of it. Other items we tried are gobi manchurian, gongura chicken, rotis, tandoori chicken, thali. Even their raita, coffee and chai are amazing. Can't find a more authentic South Indian restaurant in SF.

They can definitely improve on service like managing demand, giving a believable eta of table availability etc. But calling ahead of time for a table will help.
author: Madhuri S.

description:
One of the best sambars I have had in Bay Area. Would definately recommend for people with good taste buds
Will come back for sure to try more. :)
author: Karishma B.

description: One of the best spots for Indian food I've ever been to. A lot of variety in the menu, great quality, nice desserts and choice of wine, with specific suggestions what to pair it up with.
author: Alena N.

description:
This is my favorite Indian spot in SF by far!
Outstanding authentic food with a wonderful friendly staff and cozy restaurant!
author: Zachary M.

description: Recent transplants to SF, me and my wife have been craving Indian food. Especially great naan bread. They definitely hit the spot on that craving. I never miss out on the garlic naan.
author: Mario I.

description: Ordered chicken 65 and paneer tikka masala for lunch. First the food was ready for delivery in 5 mins. When we received it, it looked nothing like the pictures. It was below average at best. No flavor and seemed to be heated up and was not fresh. Waste of money. Don't order from here. Huge disappointment. I'm not sure how it has 4 star rating.
author: Nandini S.

description:
Waaaaaaaaaaaaaay overpriced. The $6 dessert I got was MINISCULE. it's smaller than my hand and definitely not worth it. 
Also, I don't recommend savory lassi unless it's something you already know that you like it.
author: Astrid V.

description: It was a rainy night so we decided to stay in our SF hotel and order in. We found this place through uber eats and placed an order of chicken tikka masala, mango lassi, rice, naan bread, cauliflower chili, etc. Delivery was fairly fast at approx 35 min. However, when my husband got upstairs with the food, he thought our mango lassi was missing but soon we realized we had the wrong order delivered. There was no way to get in touch with the driver, so we called Deccan spice and they were able to tell us that our food was still there. They were very helpful because I think they were able to contact uber eats because uber eats called us minutes later only to let us know we would have to reorder the food. Since we were already starving and had no access to a fridge (fridge in hotel room was locked and full with mini bar stuff), we ended up eating the food delivered which was a chicken biryani with egg and chili chicken? it was good, even after it had been siting there for a while.
author: Beth M.

description:
I was terribly disappointed. It seemed like it was popular, so we were excited. 
We made reservations, and were seated fairly promptly. This where the good part ended.
Our service was extremely poor. We waited 15 minutes for wine, and when it came it was only 1 glass,  it too another 15-20 minutes for the 2nd glass...after asking 3 times.  The food service was similarly slow. 

We ordered:
1) Schezwan Gobi - all batter, no cauliflower. 
Interesting but not terribly good fusion
2) Goat Andhra-very salty
3) Shrimp Lolly Lolly - heavy on the cream light on the coconut, and it seemed like the shrimp were boiled separately and tossed in the sauce, no flavor. 
4) Special Spring Dosa - was over cooked and arrived after we got the bill.

Steer clear,!
Go to Dum on 24th or Dosa.
author: Nathaniel H.

description:
Some of the best Indian food I've ever had! Not only is the food fantastic, the prices are also great, especially for San Francisco. 

I brought a group of picky high school students to eat here and they all loved it!
author: D T.

description: Good food . Owner came and spoke to us. Nice to see his enthusiasm .A bit salty which is why I took off one star
author: Shrestha M.

description: It's a really cute space with a spectucular central chandelier.  My wife and I were warmly greeted when we entered and were seated right away.  The waitstaff were really pleasant and attentive.  Unfortunately there was a really obnoxious couple sitting next to us, which made us decide to leave and eat our food at home.  They were speaking so loudly that it was impossible for us have a conversation.  I want to stress that this wasn't the fault of the restaurant staff at all and we'll be back to try again on a different night.
author: Paul V.

description: This place is the bomb everything from service to food I will most definitely be back here and I'll bring friends and family as well. I had Briyana with lamb in it and it was hella good.
author: Matthew L.

description:
We called Deccan spice and asked if they could take a large group (8 people) right away for a late dinner. They were kind on the phone and took great care of our group, despite rolling in at almost 10pm when things were otherwise winding down.

Food was authentic with a great, nicely seasoned flavor. We very much enjoyed the curries and breads, and the biriyani stood out.

I'd definitely return for a pleasant experience and great food, and added Deccan spice to my go to delivery list as well.

Note: Watch out about parking in the turning lane on valencia! The cops keep a close eye out there.
author: Aaron F.

description: Worst food and delivery experience bar-none. Rogan Josh was so spicy it was inedible - MILD was requested. Tikka masala was a watery, flavourless, disgusting mess. Rice was unseasoned (no saffron, etc.), COLD and served in chinese takeout containers. Tried to work with the restaurant to make this right and they just blew us off.
author: Chris H.

description: I've never been disappointed by the food or service here. I'll definitely be coming back regularly
author: Mark C.

description: I ordered delivery from here n I do all the time.. this time was very special that I ordered Haleem and it was super fantastic... I really appreciate the chef.. I love this place and delivery was very fast ,, they really open till mid night. I highly suggest this place to give try....
author: Anil P.

description: It's a nice and decent restaurant............ and great serving by the guy dhanu.is a great family restaurant.
author: Siva Y.

description: Amazing food, authentic Indian food. Really enjoyed the Chicken Manchurian! Excellent service as well the server was really kind and attentive.
author: Malcolm N.

description:
I came first time here and had dinner with my crew
And I liked a lot. The food was delicious and tasty
Mainly, serving was good.
author: Vamsi D.

description:
I really wanted to like this place but I had a not so great experience.  I ordered a chicken lunch special.  It is supposed to be about $13.  It said choice of two curries.  Mind you the word choice!  No listing as to what the choices are.  So I chose from the menu.  I ordered from one young man who obviously does not speak much English, but whatever, I figure they wouldn't put him on the floor if they were not confident in his order taking skills.  I asked if one could be a veggie, since I like saag panner.  They said okay.  I looked at the Chicken curries, there was one that said Chicken hiper..? (I can't pronounce it but its a curry.)  I picked that one.  I wait.  The check came, I gave them a card.  The credit slip came, it reads $41 and change.  I say, "Um, No?!  How does a lunch special total $41???"  I DID NOT SIGN!! (Hence, I did not agree to the charges.)

The other young man who speaks English comes and looks puzzled because he had confirmed the chicken curry with me, and I said, yes, for the lunch special.  (I came in saying I wanted a lunch special!)  He takes the bag away and presumably removed whatever items were in there and give me back what should amount a lunch special, I think.  I don't know since I did not look inside the bag at that point.  He adjusted the credit slip, -$28 and change and says I don't have to sign.  I leave with the bag.

In my bag, when I got to work by there was: a dal container 1/3 filled, some mixed rice, some white rice, a small sweet bread pudding like item and a curry.  Some of the items looked like they has been poured out to equate a lunch special, perhaps??  Nothing was what I ordered!  Mind you, no Saag Panner!)   I am looking at my bank account and it still has the $41 dollar charge and not the adjustment!  He took the bag, he removed items and still charged me?? I hope not and that the adjustment is delayed.  I hope to see it by tomorrow, otherwise I will be calling the bank to ask for the charge to be reversed.
author: Maricela L.

description:
The special biryani is amazinggg!! 

We have tried the garlic naan (great), chicken tikka masala (great), dosa (okay) so far. 

Just go there for the food. If you are finicky about the seating and ambience and all that...take the food to go. But try this place once, it's one of the better indian restaurants in the city.
author: Rapunzel C.

description: This is our go to place in the mission! Everything is good from garlic naan to the masala. Service is attentive and helpful. Great hidden gem!
author: Jaclyn B.

description: Really yummy Indian food!   We're vegetarian and love that most of the dishes let you pick the protein. Love the creamy tikka masala and saagwala!  Friendly staff and nice space, if slightly loud at times.
author: Darius C.

description: We waited over 2 hours for our food to be delivered. Endless conversations with the Eat24 yelp rep and the restaurant, which kept assuring us our food was out on delivery. The food NEVER came! We were forced to cancel our order after waiting over 2 hours which is completely unacceptable! I will fix and update this review if the restaurant decides to correct their mistake but I cannot recommend this restaurant after our terrible situation.
author: Toby I.

description: The restaurant did not include the chai tea I ordered and the bhel puri did not include potatoes, tomatoes, or chick peas as advertised.  What came was just puffed rice with a little bit of onion and mint. Not ordering from here again.
author: Dan J.

description: Great food! Open very late which is convenient. Some of the best Indian food I've had in the Mission.
author: Mathew W.

description: A solid experience. The waiter are very nice and they have a great buy one get one deee happy hour from 4-6pm! Their samosas and dosas are yummy. The samosa presentation could use a little work., but it didn't affect the taste :)
author: Gretta S.

description: Wonderful food, wonderful staff. Couldn't hope for anything better. Outstanding! Will be coming back many more times.
author: Matthew V.

description:
chilli chicken was good ,need to improve on chicken biryani 

Overall a must have place to visit to taste the Indian cuisine
author: Vijaypal R.

description: Best Indian food in SF! We love this place and order delivery a couple times a month- it is SO good. We are obsessed with their tikka masala and onion naan. Everything we have tried has been great.
author: Sarah N.

description: This place serves some truly authentic Lamb chops! Their Biriyani is good. Best of all, they are open till 3am and you can't find a better indian food in the area.
author: Harish K.

description: Definitely one of the best Indian restaurants in San Francisco. Schezwan chicken reminded me of our good old Indian chinese. Do try their biryanis and other South Indian appetizers.
author: Rashmi B.

description: Probably the best place to have authentic Indian dishes in San Francisco. Have been to almost all the Indian restaurants in the city but this little gem of a restaurant in the heart of Mission District takes the honours by far. The flavour and aroma leaves a lasting impression on your taste buds and compels you to come back for more.
author: Tanumoy G.

description:
Love medu vada, podi dosa and vegetable dum biryani. I especially love the sambhar since it's quite spicy and I like it that way.
Quite a simple place but i love their food.
author: Soumya H.

description: This place was awesome! Quick and tasty with huge portions. And they are open after midnight
author: Erik S.

description: Had a lovely lunch with friends on a Saturday. Nice atmosphere, quiet, cozy setting, and attentive service. Food was very flavorful with slow-cooked hearty sauces and great spices. Although overall pretty spicy. Top picks were the lentil soup and chaat samosa dish. Would recommend for anyone looking for good South Indian food.
author: Daria I.

description: How did i missed it before?! Yummy indian food. Loved it to the core!! With good service and pleasant bollywood songs
author: Sharath C.

description: This place on Valencia is one of the more authentic Hyderabadi cuisine restaurants in the city. Try the Hyderabadi Dum biryani and the dosas! Great service too!
author: Harshal B.

description: Oooh lovely place to have some food...food lovers please have food over here.this place rockssssss
author: Nk S.

description: The taste of the food was amazing and very delicious. We ordered the tikka masala with chicken and it was flavorful and tender. Be advised to order an extra side of rice, as the rice portion is specific to a single portion and is just complimentary. The rice is perfectly cooked and the garlic naan was delicious both by itself or dipped in the masala sauce. The owner is very considerate and we will definitely be ordering from here regularly.
author: Raina W.

description: Average food at best. I don't understand why these guys have a 4 star rating because nothing we ate was tasty other than the dosas. Not a restaurant I would recommend to anyone. There's not a lot of great options in SF so this one may survive.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Fantastic new Indian place in the Mission. We tried a variety of dishes, all of them were really delicious:

- Chilli Gobi: A spicy fried cauliflower dish, also available with paneer (next time!). My least favorite dish, but still really tasty. The flavors were all good, but I wish it were spicier. The cauliflower was really tender and soft. 
- Schezwan Gobi: They accidentally brought us this dish, and gave it to us on the house once they realized their mistake. This is BY FAR the better cauliflower dish in my opinion. The sauce on the cauliflower is delicious, and the pieces of cauliflower were perfect, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. One of my favorites.
- Onion dosa: Basically a huge, indian spiced crepe that's filled with onions. It was crispy, flaky and soft all at the same time. The sauces it came with were all really good also. It came with a spicy tomato based sauce, a yogurt sauce, and an apple sauce. Good, but super filling and really big!
- Andhra Chicken Curry: I wanted to go with the lamb, but my friend doesn't like it so we went with the chicken. This was probably my favorite dish here. It was properly spicy (my friend was sweating), and the curry had a lot of depth and complexity. You'll get a large whiff of spice as you walk through the door, this curry is probably what it's from. Super good, a must order! Rice was included.
- Garlic Naan: I usually tend to try and eat low carb and stay away from Naan, but I had heard this place has good naan. IT DOES. The naan was some of the best I've had in the city. Buttery and soft, it was a perfect vehicle for the curry, and helped with some of the heat.

The only non-positive thing I can say is that the service was a bit slow, but that's to be expected from a place that's only been open a couple of months and is still getting their groove down. If you like Indian food you should really give this place a try. I'll definitely be back to try their tandoori chicken and some of their paneer dishes.
author: Eric W.

description: This is the best Indian food in the Bay Area.  The tender chicken in their Hyderabadi Chicken Korma is always excellent. Their lamb dishes are amazing as well. Some of the best garlic naan ive ever had. Their mango lassis are perfect here. The food here tasted like a high end Indian restaurant. Highly recommended! My new go to Indian place. Also try the Roganjosh if you like spicy food!
author: Zee K.

description: We ordered delivery from this place and what arrived was so sad :-( :-( super small portion of the $19 tandoor platter (barely enough for 1 person), and everything was super dry. It's a shame because their delivery was really fast, which rocked, but the food was no bueno.
author: Mark Z.

description:
Scanning through the reviews...did the rest of reviewers go to completely different restaurant?

I really wanted to like this restaurant but both the food and the service were horrible with a capital H.

The seating is very tight but there is nothing wrong with that. However I do take offense that no one is managing the line and it feels Wild West at times. A poor woman must have been waiting for half an hour only to have other people taking the vacant seat she was promised.

The food is subpar. Our lamb curry was too salty and shrimp curry was so heavy that you can barely tell the coconut base. Then the dosa was a bit too burned.

But the worst is the service. We had to ask three times to get our wine which came in a water glass. Out dosa came a full half hour later than everything else (after we received our check). Totally dissatisfied with our experience.
author: Jim L.

description: I love this place! Their food is delicious and i love their non-veg tandoori platter with chicken tandoori and juicy lamb chops!
author: Sagar G.

description: I used to love this restaurant and their food even though they didn't deliver food on-time. THEN THIS HAPPENED, two days ago I ordered a chicken biriyani and I found a rusted metal thing from it. It was around 2" long. I was totally freaked out and complained to Eat24 then they tried to contact the restaurant owner and told him about this but he put them on a long hold and didn't respond. Eat24 refunded me anyway but still that really freaked me out. So, check your food before you eat it.
author: Anjala V.

description:
Edit: received my food for free for the below. Still not sure I will risk it. Upgrade from 1 to 2 stars.

I ordered food for the first time from here through eat24 and it took 2.5 hours to get to me. I called the restaurant after repeated unsuccessful attempts to get anyone at the eat24 app and the person on the phone said the delivery guy would be here in 5 minutes but took an additional 20. The food was cold and not great when it got to me. The guy didn't follow the instructions about going down the driveway to the front door so he had me walk to the street instead of coming up to the door after thoroughly screwing up my order. 

Never again, Deccan Spice.
author: T P.

description:
Pros: The food was delicious! We ordered channa masala which was bomb. And the onion masala Dosa which comes with various chutneys and was awesome as well. 

Cons: 40 minutes after we entered our order, the waiter told us they lost it and need to enter it again. It was frustrating because we were hungry and he refused to offer us a complementary appetizer. 

Resolution: I told the manager about our situation and he comped our entire dinner. I thought that was very generous and they definitely deserve the 4 stars for the food alone, plus making up for their mistake. 

Summary: food may take a while, wait staff might not get the order right, but the food is amazing and the manager helped a lot!
author: Lea S.

description: I was on trip from Southern California to San Francisco and I must tell food from SoCal to NoCal is absolutely different. Deccan Spice was amazing experience with their quick service, good food and good desi vibes around. Indiam food lovers should absolutely give it a try!
author: Keyur M.

description: Very disappointed. Food is not fresh. Ordered 3 Biryani's, which are not tasty. Eggs are boiled 2 days ago.
author: Vivek B.

description: My boyfriend and I love this place - the staff is very friendly and the food is delicious. We're big fans of the chicken biryani and butter chicken. Also make sure to order a mango lassi to drink!
author: Falon D.

description: Delicious!! I had the mulligatawny soup and idly/vada combination.  The spices were balanced and everything tasted fresh. Will definitely return.
author: Emily F.

description: I had not tried this small restaurant till one of my friends asked me to go there with her. The restaurant features classic Indian food, although it has some influence from a specific part of India, but I can't recall which one. I just loved their chicken dish and the delicious "garlic naan" and at least I must describe the wonderful "lassis" they make. I also had a dish with curry sauce, noodles and chicken, but I can't recall its name. It was really good, although it was quite spicy. To be honest I highly recommend this place and I definitely will go there again with my family and friends.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Amazing Indian food, especially considering how late they are open. I came here with a friend at 2:30am and their chicken masala and garlic naan was really good. Will visit again when I'm craving a late night snack.
author: Robert S.

description:
What a welcome addition to the neighborhood!!

Had lunch at 11:30 on Sunday with my fiancee, my parents, and my brother. We were seated promptly and they checked in on us a couple times before we ordered.

Things we ordered:
*Masala dosa
*Mysore masala dosa
*Kara dosa
*Custom uthapama (peas, carrots, tomatoes)
*Veg platter - which BTW comes with a lot more food than specified. It says rice OR roti, but actually comes with white rice, biriyani, roti, AND dessert. The vegetables of were veg tikka masala and dal fry
*Masala chai - this was GREAT - I had 2!

The quality of the food was great. My favorite was the mysore masala dosa, but the veg platter was really good as well. The veg tikka masala and biriyiani in particular were good, but the dal was way too garlicky (and that's from a noted garlic lover).

The prices are what I'd consider par for course for SF Indian food, though higher than what I'd like to pay having grown up in the South Bay.

Service was more of a mixed bag - water remained unfilled for a while, and we had to remind them of one of our sides.

Still, given it's a new restaurant, I'm willing to let the service piece slide (for now). I'll definitely back!
author: Rohan N.

description:
Awesome cozy restaurant. Family vibe. Flavorful!
Chicken 65 and garlic and cheese nan are the bomb. Need to go back and try other things!
author: Severin S.

description:
I ordered samosas, chicken koorma, garlic naan, and the Madras coffee and it was all sooo good!! I highly recommend trying this place. I'm definitely coming back when I'm in the city. 

*Lost one star because it took a while for us to order and get our food, but other than that I really enjoyed the food.
author: cindy c.

description: This is quite literally a revelation. The food was absolutely on point. Quite surprised at the fact that both south and North Indian food was impeccable. I wish I had a picture to share but we ate the plates of deliciousness so fast there was no time to take a photo. The service was praise worthy especially that late at night (1am). The host served with a smile and everything we ordered was delicious. I wish I could leave a 6 star review but 5 stars is all I can give. Definitely returning again!
author: Sher K.

description:
We had the chili naan, saag paneer, and chana masala. Everything was delicious! 

The restaurant is a bit of a hole in the wall, so not the most impressive ambiance, but good food is worth sacrificing fancy tablecloths for, as far as I'm concerned. 

Would return and recommend to friends.
author: Hillary D.

description: I ordered delivery from Deccan Spice. One of the first things I noticed when I received the food was that the rice was cold in the middle - not a good start and obviously a food safety issue. I had selected "mild" for the main course but it was so spicy I couldn't eat it, and I generally have no problem with spicy food. The chicken was poor quality. To top off an already negative experience, they signed up my phone number for marketing text messages without permission (see attached screenshot).
author: Greg H.

description: I had the idli and vada combo.  It was very good. Sambhar was great. I had Salt lassi to wash it down and that was good too. Nice decor and friendly staff.
author: Subuddh P.

description:
Love it! Great flavors and the know the Indian spices well.  

When you ask for spicy the food is SPICY! 

I've eaten in twice and and ordered take out once. Not disappointed yet. Will be going back soon.
author: Wildeflower M.

description: One of the best Indian restaurants in the city. The Kara dosa and Andhra goat curry are excellent. Service for dinner on a Sunday night was great. Very polite and attentive. And they had Kingfisher beer! Yum!
author: Tanya K.

description: Have ordered from this place a couple of times. Dosa and Sambar were pretty authentic! My parent who visited from India loved it too. Next time, I tried was their chili chicken and yellow dal. Both were pretty damn good. Very good value for money - I'll definitely order again.
author: Rohit N.

description:
Seriously delicious Indian food!

As a girl with a ton of Indian friends who love to have me over for home-cooked meals, I know that my standards for solid Indian fare are higher than most. Still, I know I'm not the only person who's noticed the slightly bland, mediocre quality of most Indian restaurants in the city. 

Enter Deccan Spice! I've ordered delivery from here twice, and both times, I've been beyond satisfied with the rich, flavorful authenticity of each dish. Being a creature of habit, I always order the same thing: lamb tikka masala, spicy aloo paneer, and an order of gulab jamon. 

I can say this is most definitely the best Indian food there is in San Francisco-- and I even found out that they do large catering orders for corporate events (score!)! They give you an order of plain rice with your tikka masala order, which just makes sense (you'd be surprised how many places don't do this). I would give 5 stars, but the food keeps coming packaged differently each time and some of the packaging was flimsy and leaked last time I ordered. Also, I'm a pretty non-discriminate gulab jamon fan, but the gulab jamon I ordered last time came flavored with cardamom, which I've never seen done and wouldn't care to experience again. 

All in all, this place has become a staple in my weekly delivery rotation--in fact, I'm about to order right now!
author: Halli A.

description: I had egg biryani and my wife had lamb biryani at this place. It was amazing!!. We tried biryanis at multiple other restaurants in San Francisco but none of them had Hyderabadi biryani taste. If you are looking for Hyderabadi style biryani this is a place to check out.
author: Madhava R.

description:
Gawd this was really disappointing The dosa had only a spoon of potatoes and the biryani was dry. The naan was like a super crispy tortilla. 
Waste of time.
author: N B.

description: Love the food. The veg biryani and the chicken 65 is my favorite. Be sure you can handle the spice though!
author: Vidya K.

description: Since I live a block away, I thought my friend and I would try this new place on New Year's Eve.  What an absolute delight.  From the moment we walked it I was comfortable.  A good indication fo the place's quality might have been the number of ethnic Indians populating the tables.  We ordered samosas and spring rolls to begin and there were spicy and fresh at the same time.  My Decan biriyani was some of the best I have ever had and enough to feed a family of three.  The chicken, spices, hard-boiled egg were all perfect.  The goat curry was also expertly well done.  the $9 bread basket left us with enough for another day.  I highly recommended this restaurant and kick myself for waiting so long to try it out.  I wish them the best in 2017 and beyond.
author: James S.

description: Food was so flavorful. I'm vegan + GF and their dosa was the best I've had. And I've been to India. Cozy spot with amazing food!
author: Hyo Jin Y.

description: I visited this place last Friday with my friends to give a try for Indian new restaurant in SF city ...Simply awesome ....Very tasty and Food quality also pretty good ...I liked the place ....I highly recommend this place to have some quality food in SF city.
author: Hari K.

description:
I don't recommend the chili paneer. However this place has good sambar and the sandwich dosa is pretty awesome! Mango lassi not that bad.

The ambiance is okayish.
author: Saloni J.

description: Ordered takeout and was highly disappointed.  All the dishes I ordered were soupy; chicken tikka masala was horrible - just a slop of sauce and a couple pieces of chicken.  The saag paneer was sub par - I couldn't eat it - it's actually gross.  The free chicken biryani looked promising till I ran across the bones - dry chicken on the bone scattered in the dish.  Horrible experience, but grateful for other great local Indian Restaurants.  Best part was the plain simple rice.  Otherwise, oh no!
author: michele g.

description: Ordered it for delivery from Eat24.  Besides the fact that it came close to 45 minutes late, the food was not good.  Maybe it was just very cold, due to late delivery, but this experience definitely ruined it for me.  Will not eat here again
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Fits the definition of hole in the wall!  Delicious food!  Ordered the dosa, slightly over browned but quite tasty.  The fact that they served it after 8:00 pm is commendable!  Loved the casual nature of this restaurant but they could invest in a bit more decor, a bit more clean look.  Very friendly wait staff, personally come out to get people in who are waiting outside.  That will hopefully change once they invest in a little more technology.

Half a curtain on their huge window might be good so, peeps waiting outside don't have to peer into your plate full of deliciousness!
author: Chitra J.

description:
We ordered too much food as per uzh. However, I'm so glad we did so we can have more tomorrow! We weren't sure what to expect, but I love Indian food and my boyfriend is adventuresome, so we came here. It's a rando storefront, but the interior manages to be both romantic/cozy and palatial. There are comfy booths and a huge hanging chandelier with (mostly) Indian music piping through the sound system. I feel like maybe somebody's mom is cooking in the kitchen, because *every* *single* dish we had was lavishly layered with spice and calibrated seasoning. It honestly tasted like love. While we were there on a random Tuesday night, there were mostly Indian patrons and a sh*t ton of take out orders. Okay, the FOOD:
We ordered everything spicy (as we do, Boo). My BF got a salty lassi, and we ordered some ridiculous fried cauliflower (chili gobi) in some red sauce with peppers and onions that was out of this world delicious. The breading was light and flavorful, and the sauce was complex and...well...saucy. That was followed by a lamb curry (Andhra) and a cabbage/paneer curry (paneer bhurji). The lamb curry was both tangy and spicy (without being overwhelming), and the cabbage and cheese dish was rich and creamy. We got pickles which are an Achilles Heel of mine, and they were insanely good. We also had rice, garlic/cheese naan (I know, it's not a real thing, but it's so freakin good), and the keema dosa, which was a crepe with meat and spices inside. All in all, one of the most satisfying Indian food experiences I have had in a long time. You. Must. Go. To. There.
author: Susan C.

description: The waitress was so very kind, I hate to write this review, but the food was utterly terrible. It all tasted like it came out of cans. Even the chai was undrinkable. I'm not sure what's going on with these guys. I wish them luck on improving their food quality.
author: Susie W.

description: We brought a large group and ate family style to try lots of dishes. Everything was outstanding! From the dosa, vindaloos, curries, masalas... Delicious. The service was tremendous and we had an amazing meal. We will definitely be back.
author: Michael L.

description: Good food, nice discovery when we were looking for udupi palace in the Mission and it was busy, so we tried this place down the street and were pleasantly surprised. We had the dosa and idle. One of the best dosas we have had in the Bay Area, highly recommend it!
author: Abhinav A.

description:
Update: I guess I was really excited about this place when it opened, but recent visits have left me somewhat underwhelmed. There's this regrettable tendency of many Indian restaurants to regress to a state where a) dosas don't quite hit the mark with a sogginess / unnecessary oiliness, b) curries start to acquire this overly spiced sameness. It's not a bad restaurant but it's a far cry from what it was in its first two weeks.

My original review here:
This is about as close to authentic South Indian food as you're going to get in SF.  Dosas and vadas that aren't super greasy, accompanied by a bunch of delicious chutneys and sambar - pretty much how Indian fast food ought to be. If I had to pick an Indian restaurant in the neighborhood, this would be it.
author: Karthik R.

description:
If only I were non-vegetarian, this place would get five stars. I usually stick to the "breakfast" items such as dosa, idli, vada etc. and am generally happy with the quality. However, I'm skeptical about the recent changes around two "smaller" dosas instead of the traditional single larger one. The dosa often tends to be low on salt and the masala quite salty - so bit of a problem with the overall dish sometimes. Please bring back the one larger dosa. The idli vada combo tends to be pretty meager - certainly for the price, one would expect a lot more. 

All in all, the non-vegetarian items seem to be a lot better, at least that's what my dining companions seem to think. 4 stars is fair from my perspective. The management is experimenting quite a bit with the items to satisfy the greatest number of customers. My advice to management is to not appeal to the lowest common denominator - retain the authentic taste without endlessly tinkering, that's what matters. Lowest common denominator == boring.

P.S. Plain rice was 4$ - that's just wrong.
author: H R.

description:
This is a great find. My preference for food is definitely for in-your-face big flavors and spice. Deccan Spice delivers. I had Chicken Biryani but I managed to try a few other dishes because I was eating with a large group. In general I found the food to be authentic and not toned down for an American clientele. 
There are several good places for Biryani in town and this one is as good as any of them. Compared to Dum Indian Soul Food's Biryani, the preparation and presentation isn't as carefully done and the rice isn't the same quality, but the flavors are more authentic and spicy and more like what you might find in India.
author: Marlin L.

description: We passed by DOSA and a couple other restaurants to try this place. Wow, I've never tasted blander Indian food (we're Indian and can handle spice). Took quite a long time to get our food despite ours being the first to order. Sad to write this review, but they need to shake things up. If reading this a few months after my review date, give it a try.
author: Tahir N.

description:
Great selection of both Northern and Southern Indian food. Tastier and more down to earth than Dosa and plenty of meat dishes that you might be missing at Udupi, so this place is a great addition to the neighborhood. Probably will be our pick for casual Indian food going forward.

If you'd like something a little more experimental, I also recommend Dum Indian Soul Food on 24th
author: Peter W.

description: I've only done take out here which is super convenient, and the curry was good and not too spicy. I liked that they gave me basmati rice even though I didn't order it. Will come back again.
author: Ally L.

description: Best place for Indian food in SF ....I visited Deccan Spice in last week ...I am Virginia and I heard Bay Area is famous for Indian food and I give a try Itss been proved ..I love Dosa Idly and Vada ...Their Mango Lassi is too good. Tnq Bay Area ...Tnq DC
author: Dowlagar A.

description:
Had dinner here on Monday, and it was one of the hottest days in the City this year. Ordered the garlic naan, regular naan, goat biryani, chicken tikka, and Andhra goat curry. 

So the entrees came out rather haphazardly, but it's their first few days of operation so that didn't really matter.

The quality of the food though, from the crispy delicious naan, to the aromatic chicken, the exquisitely flavored curry, to authentic biryani. Quite frankly, there is not a restaurant in the city that can match the quality of the food.

It's a non pretentious, not too huge, place. But don't go for anything except the food. It will not disappoint.
author: Sean S.

description: I went with my friends, we all loved the food and environment. I would highly recommend this place personally. They served delicious food really quick which worked perfectly for all of us. Will definitely come here again.
author: Gagneet G.

description:
Love this food and they have awesome service ...
Especially biriyani and chilli chicken
author: Kota R.

description: My go to when I'm looking for dum style biryani (which is the best imo). The biryani is very flavorful. I haven't tried much else here, so can't speak to much else.
author: MK C.

description: My favorite Indian restaurant in all of San Francisco!! Love the flavor, and I get it on delivery too! My go to is the chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. Both loaded with flavor! Perfect spice in the chicken tikka (but if you like really spicy then ask for extra spice!)
author: Julianna M.

description:
Authentic spice palate . True Hyderbadi cuisine.
Yummy for tummy . Biryani's are too good especially Goat biryani .Desserts are good too
author: Rahul M.

description: Great currys, veggie friendly, loved the dahi batata sev poori. Fast, friendly and efficient service.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Chicken butter masala was to die for, perfect combination of spices and paired perfectly with the garlic nann. 

Other than the clubby forever 21 music vibe we loved the experience and were impressed with the authenticity of our meal. We'll be coming back for round two!
author: Laci W.

description:
Amazing foood....Great Service...Nice ambience !!!

I ordered their specialty Dil Khush Dosa and by far the best i had in California...Definitely a must try cashew curry !!!!

And the only place you will find Strawberry and Mango lassi...its thick like it should be and relishing .

I would definitely recommend this place if you love indian food and spices.Its reasonably priced and is value for money .

Cheers !!!
author: Av A.

description: To be honest- I don't really know what these Indian critics nor non- Indian critics think about this place being good. I mean it's not the worse but definitely not what people are praising. The curry dishes are the same base with just added heat, traditional Indian cooking may use the same: garlic, onion and garlic masala- but that's about it. Each gravy should be made authentic to the dish name. On top of that the Manchurian and the Tandoori had the same sauce. It's not authentic nor can I say delicious. It's merely over spiced and lacking in the true Indian flavor. For something new, they should do more research and develop their recipes better.
author: Urmi P.

description: the decor is a bit depressing but nevermind, this is a simple food place - so the food should be good right? It's not. Their biryani had undercooked chicken and for some reason some of the chicken bones had no chicken on them. That can only happen if they gave us leftovers. This is unacceptable. Never going in or ordering from here again.
author: Where A.

description: This is by far the best Indian restaurant serving authentic Hyderabadi food I've come across in US. I've been to so many places which offer biryani and other Hyderabadi food but everything comes short of this one. We ordered Chicken 65 and Chicken Dum Biryani, both of which are an example of true authentic Hyderabadi cuisine and god, they nailed the taste and flavor on the spot. The taste takes you to India. The place is neat and modest, with a simple to browse through menu offering a selection of both South and North Indian foods. To all my American friends reading this review, Indian food is much beyond Chicken tikka masala or butter chicken, please do try other items here and you won't be disappointed. Will definitely come back soon.
author: Hari Krishna K.

description: Food was decent, although not great. We ordered a lot via Caviar and for some reason the delivery took over two hours. So be careful if you're having guests over and are on a schedule.
author: Suneel R.

description: Do not come here. Service is slow- my friend got plastic bag in her food - which means it just comes from a bag and it literally tasted like tomato soup. I also had to go up twice to beg for water because it was spicy and they never gave us water- which was also gross. Go here if you want but I do not recommend it AT ALL
author: Lauren W.

description: Ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and got dry chicken. Paid $45 for the order but it's a rip off. Extremely disappointed. Won't order from here again.
author: Ben E.

description: Awesome food. Specially in late nights . We had naans and panned butter masala at 3:00 AMi. The. Night and it was absolutely amazing. Hats off to these guys for maintaining such quality.
author: Anshul A.

description: Super yummy take-out! highly reccomend the Chicken Tika!
author: Molly W.

description:
I wish I could give ZERO star instead of ONE!!! So let me start with saying if you are an Indian craving for INDIAN FOOD THEN THIS IS NOT THE PLACE TO BE AT!! 
1- They would give you frozen or stale food and when you ask them why is it cold, they give you reason saying it was made yesterday and they would heat it up for you, SERIOUSLY? 
2- They would differentiate with Common stuff like plastic cups and tissue papers instead of good beer mugs or cloth napkins which the tables next to us (where probably "AMERICAN'S" were sitting) I don't blame them as they have no clue about. 
We pay the same retail and give the same tip as them.
3- We made a bill of $182 that night just for some warm beer, cold tea and good looking stale food, if u want to have plastic kind of idli vada you should definitely go there. 
4- I would also want the owner to know​ that if you are doing this to us then don't use Indian names or food cause you don't know how to serve indians. 
5- date of me being your customer was February 25-27 check your cameras if you don't find this review authentic. And I could post the Bill. 
6- LAST BUT NOT THE LEAST, LEARN TO RESPECT OUR REVIEWS AND TAKE IT IN THE right spirit.
author: Nishad R.

description: Great chicken bryiani! Forget all these haters. The service is really friendly too,
author: Phil L.

description: Great curries. Really enjoyed the paneer and chicken curries most. Overall service is fantastic and spice level is great. They had Limca!!!!
author: Mikut S.

description: I am born and raised in southern India. This restaurant is about as close as it gets in San Francisco to back home. It's authentic Indian , not American influenced Indian (like dosa on Filmore). Twice I noticed the nearby tables asking for yogurt or water as they couldn't handle the combination of spices. I got podi dosa and malligatawney soup. Sambhar was awesome. Plan to go back again. I don't eat meat so I can't comment on the meat options. Service was super friendly and clean. Food was amazing. Hope it stays this way...
author: Nikhilesh N.

description: Fantastic food and friendly staff. We over ordered ... it it was worth it. Husband had the chicken tikka (tandoor) and it was melt in your mouth fantastic, I had lamb vindaloo which was just the right amount of spicy. Tasted others with our group, butter chicken was also super delicious. Highly recommend.
author: Christopher H.

description: Great food, nice atmosphere, good music, and attentive service. The tikka masala with lamb was DELICIOUS and the sauce was particularly good. Tandoori chicken was also good and a little spicier than I'm used to - which I liked. Highly recommend!
author: R W.

description: Food was terrible. We ordered the saag paneer and butter chicken. We sent the food back and needed to discuss with the server to be comped the food.
author: M. M.

description: Just ordered two tikka masala goat and one veggie  and got some yellow sugary shit! wtf... never again for delivery! Charge 2 dollar extra for goat meat and gave us mainly bone! I was looking forward to some spicy mid night snack! Very disappointing!
author: diana l.

description: This place, is a small restaurant on Valencia. The food is pretty decent. We ate the Biryani which was pretty good, However the eggs smelled weird. The service is absolutely terrible. The waiter said they are short staffed but but with only about 8 tables; half of them empty it wasn't a hard job to do so. We were served water after a while and it was never refilled. We didn't get silverware even after the food was served on our tables and had to wait for a while for it. Fortunately we were able to get our food in time but there were other customers waiting for over 30 mins for vegetarian dishes. Lack of quality service is what puts this otherwise good restaurant to shame.
author: Varun C.

description: It's good that this place is open late night but the staff working in front takes their customer very casually. I sat There for 10 minutes and servers were busy checking their phone and were not willing to even have a look in front . I called them 3 times and then the girl showed up very casually as if she is doing a favor to me ... food is average but customer service need to well polished ..
author: Jyotsna P.

description: I'd have to order three times as many meals to get remotely full. Needlessly to say, I'm never coming back to this restaurant. I ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and Butter Chicken. Tiny!!!
author: Chris B.

description:
A big wow and kudos to the Deccan spice Restaurant. Went there for dinner on a busy Saturday night with a party of 6 and am satisfied to my utter core. Fell in love with paneer Bhurji dosa and my Italian friend just loved the special uthappam. Mango lassi is one of the best I have ever tasted. The variety of wine and beer this restaurant is offering really blew my mind. The overall experience is justified every penny. The warmth offered by service staff is a cherry on the top. Would definitely visit again. 

Hint : They also deliver for free. Just came to know after I came here. 

Cheers :)
author: Ashik Reddy G.

description: worst food ever. the saag chicken was so salty; they forgot masala in the dosa. the chutney and sambhar was not enough to eat the dosa and idlis. idli's were a joke.  I want my money back.
author: Ajay D.

description: I've only gotten delivery thus far but the chili naan and malai kofta were great! Just the right amount of spiciness from the naan and rich flavor from the malai kofta.
author: Krishna V.

description: We ordered the Chicken and Gobi Manchurian and the Dum Biryani and it was very well prepared.The service is pretty good too.Highly recommend this place for their awesome Indian (Andhra) food.
author: Rishul N.

description:
Don't know how this place has a 4.5 star rating. The food and service was ridiculous. May be we were just unlucky but it was a series of ridiculous things that happened.

- Lassi had too much salt (more like 5 times). My friend diluted it with water and it was still salty.

- Uttapam wasn't cooked

- Ambience is super claustrophobic

- They made some tadka or some griddle based food for someone, and the whole place was full of smoke and everyone started coughing for whole of 5 minutes

- Some other ridiculous things that I'll add when I remember. My brain has blocked these bad memories.
author: Nandan S.

description:
Based on mediocre food, I would not order here again. Additionally, I called to confirm there were no nuts in the dishes we ordered as my fiance has a severe allergy and was told "100% there were no nuts". My fiance ate the Chicken Tikka and Mulligatawny Soup and had an allergic reaction. This is very bad and needs to be addressed by management and noted on all menus. 

Neither the food nor experience was enjoyable.
author: Katie B.

description: Everything we ordered were very tasty- flavorful goat jalfrezy, creamy malai kofta which featured falafel-like fried veggie balls, perfectly crispy garlic naan. The staff there were very friendly. Portion was not huge for the price, hence 4 stars instead of 5, but the crazy SF rent is probably the real culprit.
author: Yao Y.

description: The food was very good, but what was greater was the service! Came here for a friend's birthday dinner, the restaurant brought out a complimentary cake for him- it was amazing and delicious. We were a big group and they did all they could to accommodate our size. Food came out quickly and portions were good sized. Food, like I said, was delicious. We had dosas, malai kofta, chicken, pani puri, lassis, etc. if you're looking for South Indian food in the Mission, this is a great bet!
author: Afshan Q.

description: Great Indian food in San Francisco, I'm was here with my friends and an awesome experience
author: Ravi Tejal K.

description: The food was very good ,especially starters were awsome ,the receving of customers is very good..
author: Siddardha Reddy P.

description: After a long had a delicious food, appetizers are awesome, and Dry fruit Naan is the best in breads , the service is too good and pretty fast too..I will definitely recommend..!!!
author: SuDha C.

description: Finally! Delicious, fresh Indian food on the affordable. Andhra Chicken is moist, falling off the bone, spicy winning. Nice staff. Will repeat.
author: steve m.

description: I ordered delivery. It was 40 minutes late and no one called to warn me or anything. I received a tepid apology from the delivery guy and that was it. I ordered lamb curry of some sort. It was a generous serving but very fatty. I won't order from here again.
author: Jolly G.

description: Veg thali and idli samba for lunch.  All awesome.  On the thali the saag paneer really stood out, as did the roti - authentic Indian style and the rice was incredibly tasty and flavorful.  Therefore must try there biryani.  We tried the next day for evening but they had run out of the chicken, lamb and goat options by 8pm.  Obviously we arent the only ones who love their food.
author: Rajash S.

description: The menu looks promising taste is worst and not authentic. I would not recommend nor would go again.
author: Ramu Y.

description: This place rocks. Better than the ubiquitous Naan & Curry and others of that ilk. Very good selection of dosas, noodles etc. Recommended. Plus, if you have wine, corkage is free!
author: Mark K.

description: My husband and I ate here last night and were blown away by the food. Especially since you rarely find a place that does both South Indian and North Indian cuisine so well. We're both Indian so we have pretty high standards when it comes to authentic Indian flavor. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious! We asked them to make it spicy and they complied! We had the mango lassi, idli, chicken 65, teenmar dosa, lamb saag and for dessert: gulab jamun and rasmali.  Hard to pick a favorite but I think it was either the teenmar dosa or the lamb saag. Dessert: also tough to pick a favorite, as the rasmali was super creamy and the gulab jamun had the perfect texture. If you are looking for a fancy place with a nice ambience, this isn't it. But if you are looking for some great authentic food with tons of flavor, you have found the perfect place. We will definitely be back! :)
author: Amee K.

description: Deccan Spice is one of the best biriyani places in San Francisco. Also, the Chicken 555 is a must try!
author: Vignesh M.

description: I ordered the chicken lunch special. There were supposed to be two curried chickens but instead, I got two curries and one had no chicken in it (just the sauce).
