In the second curry dish there was a chicken wing (literally) and a small piece of meat. The meal was 14 bucks and there was the equivalent of 2 chicken wings worth of meat. Awful! Super disappointed in the portions. Also the naan looked and tasted like a tortilla. So weird.
author: Arlene C.

description: Deccan Spice has the most unique Indian menu.  I browse menus of Indian restaurants wherever I travel in the world.   I've always wanted to try gongura leaves ever since I read about them on my 660 Curries cookbook.  But I couldn't find them even when I scoured Indian grocers.  I found them here.  And they were delicious!
author: j c.

description: Finally! I've been let down by almost every Indian place in town so far, but Deccan does everything just right with no nonsense. Great flavor, full range of Indian cuisine, and an unbeatable price.
author: Samuel P.

description: Delivery arrived 1 hour and 35 minutes late. Food was cold.
author: Ryan H.

description: Ordered a couple curries and naan here. Rice came with the curry. The place is fairly small but well appointed with a giant chandelier hanging from the ceiling. The food is served in those metal bowls and it was all very good. Price is right.
author: Will D.

description:
The food was ok, but not far away is better food.

Their service, however, was a disaster. My bud got his main dish with no rice, no naan, no utensils. Just sat on the table alone and staring at us for a LONG time - like 10 mins. His repeated requests for the other stuff he ordered was responded with an almost inaudible "we're working on it."

The place is sparse - almost like a pop up restaurant. Just a bare room.

Not a great experience overall. Next time, I'll just stick with Pakwan.
author: Jon B.

description: Very authentic Indian food. This place is like having dinner at someone's home -- super warm and friendly. It was really busy the last two times we went. The owner and staff are really sweet and polite.
author: Victoria L.

description: Stumbled on this restaurant while wandering the increasingly gentrified Mission area. Delicious food, catering for vegetarians and carnivores, and a really friendly waitress who welcomed us with grace despite our quite casual attire. Thoroughly recommended!
author: Jill O.

description: Worst restaurant I have ever visited. Food is average but service is very bad. They were very unprofessional. I will never visit this restaurant again.
author: Rupal J.

description: This is a cute new Indian spot that opened in the Mission that has strawberry lassi! The portions were a little small but still filling. The restaurant itself is a little cramped because it's so small, but it's very intimate and casual which I like for grabbing a quick meal. The service was wondering and extremely fast.
author: Lucia S.

description: The delivery Time was on Point with Eat24!  Less than 30 mins, amazing.
author: Jimmy T.

description: I loved the strawberry lassi. Also got tandoori chicken (moist + sizzling), chicken tikka masala (lots of spices), and garlic naan
author: Melanie C.

description: Never order delivery from here. They quoted me 25 to 40 minutes and 2 hours later the food hadn't arrived. I never got it. Delivery service confirmed this restaurant is always bad with delivery.
author: Lili L.

description: The best Indian food in San Francisco hands down, both for the price and, period! Lolly lolly chicken and dal fry are spectacular. Don't forget to get a dosa with spicy chutney, too.  Wish i could give it ten stars. Keep cookin!
author: Ashur B.

description: Gobi Manchuria is a must try. Roganjosh wasn't that great. Although I regularly visit for the biryanis. Best part is it is open late night. Small place, but clean and good food
author: Z D.

description: We had the Maysur masala Dosa, paneer tikka masala, and lamb dish. All were excellent. Service was prompt, polite, and thoughtful. A great overall ambiance. One of my new favorite Indian restaurants in the city.
author: Parag C.

description: We went there last night after seeing all the reviews on yelp and the food was amazing. We ordered Mini idly's which were super cute and the Sambhar was to die for! I loved the variety of chutneys they had. We also ordered Dilkush dosa which was a huge and we savored every bite. I highly recommend this place.
author: Archie A.

description: Deccan Spice has a huge menu with items I have never tried. I was very pleased with my order! The Vada (lentil doughnut) and the Tikka Masala are very worth the try.
author: Kayla E.

description: The food was delicious! Got the tandoori chicken with tamarind chutney and it was so flavorful and not dry. My friend got the butter masala and it was even better. They have a long list of vegetarian options so it's easy for people to customize. I'll definitely be ordering in some food from here next time!
author: Jaycee C.

description:
My wife and I enjoyed dinner at Deccan Spice the other evening.  Huge selection of dishes, including some I haven't seen at other Indian restaurants.  I had the Chicken Roganjosh - the menu labeled it "delicious," and it was.  It had quite a kick to it (for reference, I'm probably a 7 on a 10 point scale for seeking/enjoying spicy food.)  My wife enjoyed the Saag Paneer.  

The staff was super friendly.  This is a new restaurant (as of summer 2016) and you can tell they want to make a good impression.  

One thing my wife and I really appreciated - they're open late for dinner.  This clinched the deal when we were debating where to eat.  Hard to go wrong at Deccan Spice.
author: Erik N.

description: Fast service, good food. Naan and pani purri are must-orders. A lot of vegetarian options which is a plus! Samosa could be spicier tho
author: Ezra W.

description: Just had dinner at Deccan Spice. It was absolutely delightful. The server is very sweet and kind. Had a good conversation with her. She listened intently and paid attention to our requests. The food was exactly as spicy as we had requested. Would definitely come again. Best Indian restaurant in San Francisco. Thank you, server A!
author: Poorva P.

description: The food is EXCELLENT, and that's what it's all about, really - hence the high rating. And the people are super nice. But the service is kind of a goat rodeo - they are trying, but it's a mess. It's probably a take-out thing for us in the future for this reason, but i do hope they get it together, because the food is too good for that to bring them down.
author: Erica W.

description: Most of these reviews are from first timers, probably friends.  Tikki was bland and not thick at all.  Food was forgettable.
author: Greg E.

description:
We went there for some after party food binge and it was totally worth it. Good food, amazing service and bollywood music made the experience one of our best. 

Would totally come again!
author: Ankit R.

description: Excellent and interesting Indian Restaurant. We get delivery from them and enjoy the deep spice on their tandoori. The salad with the cheese cubes is outstanding. The samosas are some of the best we have ever had.  We love the delicacy of the rice and the naan is sheer joy. We highly reccomend!!!
author: Peter M.

description: The food was really good! Specially the DilKush Dosa, it was very good! The food proportion was appropriate. Friendly staff!
author: Deshna S.

description: Loved the egg dosa here :). Also the servers are really courteous and make you feel at home.
author: G S.

description: Stumbled upon this place and so happy I did! Not only was the service so great, fast and kind, but the food was soooo good! Highly recommend tandoori chicken.  Will definitely come back :)
author: Jessica B.

description: I love Indian food and this is by far the best I've had in San Francisco. So good.
author: Jesse E.

description: I usually like this restaurant. It's got a no fuss setting and the food is made competently. However on the last occasion, we had to wait quite a while for a very basic meal. They were clearly backed up (there was a line of Uber drivers waiting for take out orders)and the dhal when it finally arrived had gone bad. Also the staff seemed inexperienced and were not able to manage the inflow of clientele. Usually a decent joint but my last experience was quite unfortunate.
author: K S.

description: Amazing! Super fresh flavorful food and incredibly polite and attentive staff. I got the filled dosa with the sauces and classic chicken Tika masala and was incredibly please. Great portion sizes too! I will be back. The menu is unique too and has a lot of items I haven't seen before. Plenty to try again and again.
author: Ashley H.

description: Food was dope y'all! Got us in easy in a Friday night for starving People and we were taken care of. Obviously not trendy like beretta but save your money and come here for delicious food and great service. #hotmilkballsforthewin
author: Natasha A.

description: All of the meats on the mixed tandoor were good except for the fish. The biriyani was nothing special. The waiter brought a sizzling platter to another table and suddenly everyone in the dining area starting coughing. They probably need better ventilation.
author: Amin S.

description: I got delivery from this place and the samosas were the best I've had:  hot, crispy, and delicious.
author: Ros J.

description: OK, I enjoyed the food, and the people running the restaurant - super sweet.  And I like that it is a little Tenderloin-ish - not a venture capitalist-funded restaurant.  However, a HUGE pet peeve is cleanliness of a restaurant.  You don't pay attention to the restaurant, how do I know that you are paying attention in the kitchen?  This is a brand new restaurant - and everything looks rundown and dirty.  (If the food was EXCELLENT, I wouldn't have cared as much - but this is just, good) The worst? The bathroom - obviously hadn't been looked into for days, I would assume.  It was filthy.  You have to clean your ONE bathroom every hour, that is pretty much it.  Based on that alone, I will not be recommending it to my friends.  That sucks, the food was pretty good. (not the best - but a better bargain than Dosa, which is insanely priced. However, Dosa is impeccable.)
author: Priya R.

description: Vegetarian dishes were terrible! Their recommended chettinad vegetables entree was comprised of frozen mixed vegetables cooked in gravy. It was not flavorful and definitely not worth $12 odd bucks! The veg biryani was tasteless as well. And they charged $2 for extra biryani gravy which was not even tasty. Ridiculous!
author: Doesn't Matter ..

description: This place was absolutely delicious. We got the paneer tikka masala (medium spicy), garlic naan, and regular naan. To be honest I am kind of picky when it comes to Indian food, because I've had some really awesome stuff. This place really knocked it out of the park though. The food was just spicy enough to make it have some heat without killing me, and the bread was cooked perfectly. I will definitely come back.
author: Kathleen C.

description: The food is really solid. Everything I've tried, I've liked- biryani, daal, several curries. They also have some great specials when you order online. However, delivery takes an unreasonable amount of time. Make sure you give yourself at least 1.5 hrs. You'll most likely need to reheat your food as well.
author: Alison Y.

description: This is a nice little restaurant. The food is reasonably priced, there's a good selection of South Indian vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes. The service is friendly and quick and the food is reasonably tasty and authentic. Their dosas are a little on the thicker side but I like them a little bit thicker anyway. The tea was good and they have a good selection of beer and wine. And they are open LATE unlike the rest of lame San Francisco!
author: ch d.

description: I ordered Delivery, and got the Haleem, and biryani. Biryani was good. They only had chicken Haleem, and I didn't find it to suite my taste. overall satisfactory, but not excellent.
author: Asim V.

description: Yum! Had an amazing meal! Delicious food and really great and courteous service. Try the Tandoori chicken and the cashew curry. You will not be sorry!
author: Gretchen W.

description: Extremely average fare. We had a couple of dosas. The batter was under-fermented and the masala stuffing was ordinary. Ambience is nothing to write home about. Still, the place promises to be consistently average and therefore might visit it again if other better vegetarian places are unavailable.
author: Arun R.

description: Wow, coming here from now on. Super flavorful. Reasonable pricing. Lovely people. A new favorite.
author: Walter R.

description: The food is decent, def not the best in the city but decent. Every dish is around $2-$3 too expensive. The spice level is ok if you are really into spicy food. They put a lot of food coloring in their food which is odd because having green rice in my biryani doesn't make it a better experience. Eating in is def better than getting carry out from this place. Small portions and the food just tastes better coming out of the kitchen. Staff is very nice and courteous Another tiny sf restaurant which is annoying because I don't want to bump elbows with the person next to me.
author: Virel P.

description: This place is absolutely fantastic, authentic and delicious Indian food at affordable prices.  The people who work here are also friendly and always hospitable, a pleasant neighborhood joint that hits the spot when you are hankering for some Masala or Roti or whatever.
author: Michael Z.

description: Decided we wanted Indian food and tried this place. It was a great choice. It is a small very casual restaurant and the staff greeted is right away and got us seated. We ordered Garlic and cheese naan to start it was hot and fresh out of the oven. We liked it so much we got another order of it. We also ordered chicken tikka masala and manchurian shrimp which was all very flavorful. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Jac E.

description:
My boyfriend and I ate at Deccan Spice a few days ago for a quick bite to eat before heading home. When we came in, there weren't too many people in the restaurant and a woman greeted us quickly and was friendly. I rated Deccan spice as 4 stars but I would really give it 3.5 stars.

THE FOOD: We were seated quickly and selected paneer butter masala along with mirchi bhajji and raita. The mirchi bhajji was great and I thoroughly enjoyed it as did my boyfriend. The panner butter masala wasn't as good and seemed to be missing a key ingredient -something acidic such as lemon, hing, or tamarind. The naan we ordered was freshly made, fluffy, and delicious. The raita was under salted and runny, however, this could be a matter of preference and is not necessarily a ding.

THE AMBIANCE: I was surprised how fast the restaurant filled up with patrons. The decor is very basic (however the painting on the wall is lovely) and Deccan Spice isn't somewhere I would take someone for a date.

OTHER NOTES: This place is TINY. The restroom is in the back and I wanted to wash my hands but I felt uncomfortable having to walk through the 5-6 employees crowded by the register. For the amount of employees visible to us, we did have a hard time getting someone's attention. Given that Deccan Spice seems to be a new restaurant, I'm going to positively assume that these employees were training but it should be noted if that many employees are visible then the customers should be able to make eye contact easily. 

Would I go back? Maybe. I would go back to eat the mirchi bhajji but I wouldn't get the panner butter masala again. I hope that they work out the kinks. The woman who greeted us was really lovely to communicate with and I sense that Deccan Spice is her baby. 

DISCLAIMER: I was offered a small discount for this review. For the merchant, I would recommend incorporating the proposition of discounts for reviews in a paper form instead of directly asking as well as telling the customer how much the discount is up front. I didn't ask and was slightly disappointed that the amount was paltry in comparison to how long I would put into writing this review. After all, time is money...
author: Whitney A.

description:
Very tasty mix of south and North Indian food. Just enough spicy but not too much to burn your mouth! The garlic nan was awesome, it was crispy and thin.


P.s.- You know it's AUTHENTIC when all the Indian homies are hanging out here. Highly recommended!!!
author: Danny N.

description: I came here as soon as they opened on a Tuesday morning and the staff was gracious enough to let me sit inside giving me a glass of water as they set the place up for their lunch hour.  Their menu is massive and if you are not too familiar with Indian food apart from the very familiar dishes, it could get really confusing.  To make things easier, I ordered the chicken lunch special which has chicken curry, dal soup, biryani, basmati, roti, veggie pakoras and an Indian dessert.  The dal soup was well-seasoned as well as the biryani but sadly their chicken curry was very bland and I mostly got boney chicken parts.  Loved the consistency of the curry sauce though and the heat level was exactly how I wanted it to be.  My order took considerable time as obviously they just opened for the day but they were very apologetic and gave me a free mango lassi which was delicious.  Had to pack some of my leftovers and they gave me containers and a bag for no extra charge.  Big shout out to server Keerthi for always checking every now and then if everything was fine.l with my meal.  You're awesome!
author: Janis P.

description: Delicious Indian food. Some of the best I've had in San Francisco. The service though was pretty terrible. That is the reason for the 4 stars. Our food arrived and we did not have plates to eat it with for quite some time. I'm going to give em another try since they are new.
author: Krystle L.

description: Like its name, perfect and authentic Indian food. They serves crispy naan I had been missing with good number of option for curries, try the Gobi Manchurian for appetizers
author: ExploreU E.

description: Finally, finally a Hyderabadi place in the city. Now I dont have to travel all the way to the Peninsula or South bay to quench my Hyderabadi Dum Biriyani or Andhra Chicken cravings!! I ordered  via Eat.com and although the food came late (superlate) and they were apologetic about it, the food was top notch, can beat any good hyderabadi place in the South Bay.
author: Judhajit C.

description:
Food was very meh, both quality and quantity-wise.  Service pleasant, but seems they need to work out some kinks.

There's much better Indian food in the Mission.
author: Jane D.

description: Well this is surely my new favorite Indian spot. Lovely staff and quick service. I had the kara masala dosa. Delicious but my mouth was on fire about halfway through. My boyfriend had the  Chicken tikka. It was flavorful and moist and delicious. We were plotting our return before the bill came.
author: Laura G.

description: We are on a forever quest for great biriyani in San Francisco and Deccan Spice delivered a quality biriyani! The spices were right, the chicken was tender and all around delcious. The double ka meeta is BOMB. It's like Indian bread pudding and soooo good. Definitely recommend this spot!
author: Priti K.

description: Biriyani is amazing! Also, great double ka meetha. One of the only places in the city that offers some Hyderabad fare.
author: Siddharth V.

description: No clue why anyone thought this place was any good.   Marginal Indian at best, a dive of an interior and slow service.   Bla.  Won't be back.
author: Susan C.

description: I ordered delivery from this restaurant through Eat 24. I ordered a Samosas and Goan shrimp. I requested it be mild but once the order arrived (late), the level of spice for both was absolute fire. The Goan sauce was very garlicky but I just figured that's how it's supposed to be. It wasn't until the next morning that I started experiencing a lot of digestive problems and was hating my life. I contacted the customer support at Eat 24 and they called the restaurant owner. He was extremely defensive and claimed that their food is made fresh daily (what restaurant isn't?) and that there was nothing wrong with the order. He absolutely refused to give any money back and consequently eat 24 was unable to offer anything but a two dollar coupon which was a total insult. Things sometimes go wrong with restaurants but owners should take responsibility and compensate the customer even if they believe the customer is wrong (customer is always right). Highly recommend avoiding this place.
author: Hooman M.

description: We've eaten here several times, and tried a few dishes, all of which have been excellent. The chicken tikka masala and the garlic nan bread are the best I've had, anywhere. They tone the spices down a bit, on my request, for my delicate English palette. Service is always friendly, and prompt, and prices are good. A regular go-to! Great job, guys.
author: Marcus R.

description: Awesome first experience here! Flavors were really great and the service was warm and efficient.  Come hungry and order a lot, because the menu is dense with appealing options.  So happy to have this new spot in the neighborhood.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Delicious and spicy!

Really enjoyed the masala onion dosa, gobi manchurian, and the biryani! The sambar was particularly good and I really liked the dosa masala also.
author: Sidharth K.

description: Best butter chicken I've had in several years. Lots of gluten free options, easy to get a table, and the staff is very friendly. What's not to love?
author: Joel M.

description: Food was great! Authentic indian cuisine here. I had the lamb jalfrezy and chicken tikka masala and both were great.
author: Mohammad I.

description: Amazing food and service! The dosa was perfect, and the chutneys were awesome (according to my Indian friend). The butter chicken was delicious and tender, and I could have kept eating the garlic naan all night long. Next time I'll have to save room for dessert...
author: Tyler W.

description:
I'm normally not a person who writes reviews on yelp but I couldn't stop myself from sharing this wonderful experience I had at this restaurant so that most of the food lovers like me wouldn't miss this place. I arrived at a very busy time and was welcomed by smiling wait staff and was given the booth for three of us. We ordered the Deccan special tandoor platter (seriously who wouldn't?) and we're satisfied to our utter core. Then came in the entrees which we ordered only reminded me of my mom's food (thank you Deccan spice #nostalgic) and finished our amazing dinner with a dessert. Overall an outstanding experience! Thank you Deccan Spice for coming into my life. 

PS : They serve complimentary rice with every entree. 

PPS: They deliver for free and say they will open Breakfast soon. Can't wait to come back :) Cheers!
author: Rakesh Reddy A.

description: Came here with a big party, they were able to accommodate us, food was awesome, came quickly and staff is also very friendly. And yes, great background music!
author: Mahatma G.

description: Food is delicious. average portions. Tikka masala was nice and creamy. Mango lassi was average. Service was lacking, they were slow, got a few orders wrong.. Wait staff needs some improvement and training. 3 stars for the food and minus 2 for lack of service.
author: Ingrid C.

description: Delivered over an hour late, resulting in cold food. And the order was incorrect, however delivered so late I had zero way of rectifying the situation. The garlic naan was delicious, even at sub-lukewarm temp. Will not be ordering again.
author: Rose C.

description:
Best Indian food I ever had in Bay Area.
Must try biryani, strawberry lassi and vadas
author: Muskaan N.

description: The food is delicious and on that basis I would give it 5 stars, but I ordered online and it took almost 2 hours. The estimate was 1 hour. After it was 15 minutes late I checked in and they said it was out for delivery. Thirty minutes later I called back and the guy said "let me call the driver and then I'll call you back." i got no call back but 10 minutes later my food arrived. The guy said "sorry it's late" with no explanation. So. Great food. Shit service.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Found this to be one of the best indian restaurants in sf, stepped in with my family n ordered few items was eagerly waiting for the ordered items...once d items are on my table i tasted them....and must say its really the mouth-watering dishes they cook...
            Also the service was real good n humble wish and would definitely prefer to be ordering food from deccan spice only..
        LOVELYY guys keep up your good work..I appreciate the effort n love you put in ur foodd...
author: Nikitha R.

description: North side food at its best mainly chicken tikka masala and goat roganjosh ......oh tandoor ultimate ....for sure come back place
author: Siddharth R.

description: Delicious! Good, wholesome Indian fare with pleasant staff. Made sure to get a takeout menu as well. New favorite plac
author: Juliann W.

description: This place is great! Delicious food, nice staff, and quick service. Will be a regular.
author: Matt E.

description: Came here for quick late night meal with friends. The food was exceptional! Perfectly spiced and flavorful! Will def be back again soon.
author: Zack B.

description: Good food but terrible service.. Wrong dishes brought out, had to ask for more water 3 times and still didn't get it.. Garlic naan is super and tiki masala was good but will not be returning simply for the service factor. Would give food 4 stars
author: Jack O.

description: The lamb dishes are all so fresh! The salt mango lassi was to die for. Service was fantastic. Would definitely come back when I'm in the neighborhood again.
author: Haley B.

description: We wandered in on a warm night on October with Valencia Street bustling. Enjoyed two dishes from 2 states in India, each with the subtle flavors of the region. Delich. Warm, attentive services. For sure walk in for a great meal.
author: Char C.

description: I discovered this place by chance and I have to say that I'm surprised of how delicious the food is for a reasonable price. I love Indian cuisine but this place rocks. The sauces are very good and creamy, totally hit my taste buds. Garlic naan rock. The place is pretty small and raw but looking forward for them to grow. Yum yum
author: Dagmara L.

description: Best Indian in SF, HANDS DOWN PERIOD. Paneer Tikka and All tandoori items veg/no veg are amazing !! Gongura curry shrimp is off the charts !! Great service too !!!
author: Ankur P.

description: This is probably the best Indian food I love getting it delivered. It always arrives hot and fresh. My favorite dish is the tandoori chicken and the vegetables samosas are also incredible. But everything on the menu is great. Thank you so much
author: Oscar H.

description: The ultimate food in SF...the staff is super friendly...I would recommend to try it once and after that you will get attached with thier food.
author: Amar J.

description: Really good sambar. This place is better than dosa and udupi from across the street. It's a small little restaurant but the food is solid. Best Indian food in sf.
author: Ravi R.

description: Oh my god, everything was closed on Xmas and thank Jesus that this place was open. We would have eaten anywhere but let me tell you I am a huge expert on Chicken Tikka Masala. I order it every time I have Indian food. This was the best I ever had. It was absolutely incredible. I had to eat every drop of Masala sauce, and if I wasn't in public I would've licked the bowl. Ok ok i did sneak one little lick in when no one was looking.
author: greg s.

description: We stopped in for the first time. Really terrific! The Gobi Manchurian and Cashew Curry were especially good. Quite spicy of course. It is a small, unpretentious place with very friendly servers.
author: Annie H.

description: Awesome. Killer variety, Ive tried every curry, and all of it is authentic and delicious.
author: Ryan S.

description: A very good restaurant for South Indian food! I had Idly and Vada, both came with tasty sides.
author: Deepthi G.

description:
I came with high expectations, given that this place has a 5-star rating on Yelp with 30+ reviews. Boy was I disappointed - so much so, that I felt compelled to finally get on Yelp and say something after many years of only reading reviews.

The food was bland, and the service was some of the slowest I've ever experienced. (I don't get how service could be so bad at a restaurant with 4 front of house staff for only 12 tables!)

Do yourself a favor and visit one of the numerous other Indian restaurants within a block - Udupi Palace, Aslam's Rasoi, or Dosa (in my order of preference).
author: Jacob H.

description: Best South Indian food mainly biryani and dosas combination were ultimate ....sounds great ...all come back again ....
author: Shravan K.

description: This place has pretty good food, and quick polite service. They have a casual atmosphere, and were able to seat us promptly on Friday evening. Would return.
author: Aaron B.

description: I had the paneer bhurji dosa here. Pretty good! I have stayed for 4 years in Andhra and after nearly ten years I got to have the podi and Andhra chutney. The dosas are quite authentic, lined with an interesting mix of spices. Loved it, will visit again.
author: Ishita S.

description: i am so excited that I finally have an authentic Indian restaurant so close to where I live. The food here is delicious, the service is quick and the servers are very warm. My husband and I are big fans of  biryani with flavor and a lot of places just make it spicy assuming that's what all customers need and want. Deccan Spice has got it just right. We even met the owners to let them know how pleased we were with the food. The chicken Chettinad was out of this world. A must visit if you have Indian food craving.
author: Shilpa S.

description: Awesome Food with awesome service! We ordered Tandoori chicken and Garlic naan and it was delicious. We savoured every bite. We went their randomly but looks like we are going to go back for more now.
author: Jnny K.

description: Excellent service, we ate chicken tikka masala, lily lolly chicken and garlic cheese bread. My favorite was chicken tikka masala.
author: Erika M.

description: Love the food, very nice staff. But please train the staff better. They can't explain the menu, forget things, and send food out at widely different times. Came to eat here twice. I want to come back but am afraid to bring friends because the servers are inexperienced, though very sweet and warm. Just train and supervise please!
author: Monica B.

description: I'm big fan of indian food. I have tried quite a few places my favorite order is lamb tikka masala. Deccan has great food and i highly recommend it.
author: Myk P.

description: I honestly wish I had never taken my friend here. The food was bland, dried out and totally forgettable. The woman taking our order looked super nervous and did not seem to be wanting to be there. I am a fan of Indian food and the music, but the screeching song they played left us both with a headache
author: Kitten N.

description: Ordered from here two times through YelpEats and was satisfied both times. I never had Indian food before so I can't compare it to other restaurants but in the end, I enjoyed their food and their service enough to order for delivery a second time.
author: Candy W.

description: The food might be good but the atmosphere is beyond awful. So dark you can barely squint at the menu. Non existent service. So loud you just give up on conversations. We just. changed our order to go after sitting hetr for 45 mins. Still waiting...
author: Natasha C.

description: The great food I have ever tasted before.. and the service was too gud.. the guys r too fast.. appreciated..
author: Pavan Teja B.

description: Waited almost 2 hours for delivery.  When we got our food, it was spilled all in the bag. And we had missing food from our order. When we called to get our food they was missing, they hung up on us
author: B Z.

description: Took 2 Hours to Deliver! Food was mediocre and prices were above average. I ordered my chicken medium + and it was mild!
author: Moon G.

description: My friend Jon suggested this place for lunch. We walked in and sat ourselves down because no one greeted us. We looked at the lunch specials but the menu was confusing in terms of what you actually get so I ordered a la carte. I ordered what I guess was an appetizer but it was a huge dish called Chicken 555. I also go rice, a plain naan and a Tiger beer. The Chicken 555 arrived by itself way ahead of all the other orders which was weird. We wanted to all eat together but when I asked where my other food was and where the food of my friend was we got a "They're working on it." It took a while for the rest of the food to arrive so the Chicken 555 got cold. Since we were waiting I asked if I could have my beer. It arrived in a bottle so I asked for a glass. A glass arrived but it was so grimy and had dishwasher baked on food so I asked if I could have a clean glass. The waiter took my glass and wiped it with a cloth or something then bought it back. Now I had a dirty glass with smeared dirt inside and outside the glass. Needless to say, I drank from the bottle. The food was actually pretty good. The Chicken 555 was spicy and looked great too. The naan was fluffy and fresh. The rice was ok. I wanted to give it three stars but the service and randomness of the food delivery does not merit it. I probably won't be back but I hope they figure it out. There aren't enough Indian places around in San Francisco. Oh, the music was too loud. A lot of places do this now. It's really annoying.
author: Nathaniel R.

description: The food was average, and it took over an hour to be delivered. But the real issue was that some of the pieces in the chicken tikka dish weren't cooked on the inside.
author: Maya E.

description: Excellent Indian food. Had the tandor platter. Super spicy and hot and delicious. Great mango lassi as well. Good service and was able to make a reservation easily. Would come back again next time I'm in the area.
author: Henry C.

description: This place blows. Bad food. Bad, bad bad. Grease bombs. Ugh. I was so disgusted. The service is clueless and weird. Horrible lighting. Makes the food look even worse. Purplish fluorescent lighting combined with darkness. Blaring loud Bollywood untz untz club music. I like this sort of music, but not to the point where it makes me feel like little doodle bugs are dancing in my pancreas. I ordered the GLOPPY AND FLAVORLESS biryani. It looked like congealed vomit on a hot day, mixed with chunks of fried poop. Tasted like warm cottage cheese that had been soaked in watered down lemonade. The cheese naan, which really should be called NON was a disgrace. It was filled with cheddar cheese and looked like a bursted ovarian cyst in a medical journal. Disgusting. Took one bite and thought "if I take another bite of this crap I'll fart myself to death and be very sad." So, needless to say I didn't take any more bites of that silliness. I ordered raita to go with the naan. Of course, the server didn't tell me that my main meal already came with raita. So, he brings me a VAT of runny raita. I just wanted to cry at this point. Also, the chai was A joke. The joke was on me. Because every time you get a refill of their 6oz lukewarm chai they charge you $4. Four mother flippin dollars for something that sits in an urn near the goddamn bathroom. So that means I paid $16 for some goddam coffee water. Like , what the goddam hell? Seriously? All the other Indian and Pakistani restaurants charge $1. $1 and you can have as much as you want. You know why? BECAUSE IT'S NOT THAT GOOD & IT IS MEANT TO BE A FOIL FOR HEAVILY SPICED PUNGENT EXOTIC FOOD. And, it costs about .03 cents to make. They charge you out the ass for their disgusting food. $40 + tip for something that would cost me less than half as much at Pakwan. That's right, I mentioned a different place. Pakwan is far superior. This place sucked the life out of me. I was so disappointed. I told all my friends. And I have a lot of friends. One of my saltier friends laughed at me and said" haaa! That place sucks!"
author: michelle b.

description: Great classic Indian spot! Definitely recommend the Tandoori Chicken, super tender with the perfect amount of spice. Also, the staff was very friendly. Can't go wrong if you're looking for good Indian food.
author: Alex G.

description: Best south Indian food in SF. Recommend the special biriyani, everything is a bit on the spicer side.
author: Naveen S.

description: Great food, reasonable prices, fast friendly service, and discounts for Yelp reviews! We had the biryani, Doha, uttapam, butter chicken, and garlic naan. All were good.
author: Nick K.

description: The food tasted homemade and fresh. Happy to find another good Indian restaurant in the Mission. Service can be improved though. Be prepared to wait for a table.
author: Ashwathi K.

description: Love this place!! Chill atmosphere, amazing food, great price. I went here with my boo on a Friday night and had a great date. He had the chicken chettinad which he loved and I had Chana masala. Both spicy and delicious. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Katie B.

description: The food was prepared with attention to detail, very flavorful, quality ingredients, friendly service. I'll be back again.
author: Chris H.

description: Terrible experience! The andhra chicken curry had curry that reeked of lamb - clearly they either use the same curry for both or they use the same utensils to make both. Also, the goat biryani had pieces of chicken in it, and again some parts of the rice smelled like lamb. The most appalling thing was when all of this was pointed out to a lady who appeared to be the manager, she told us that she will look into it and didn't come back till we had finished our meals - and when she did, she had apparently completely forgotten about it and asked if we enjoyed our food. Of course we didn't. Absolutely nothing was done to rectify the issue. Moreover, we were charged for two items that we had ordered but which they forgot to serve. This seems to be a new restaurant in the area, so don't be fooled by the high ratings like we were. Unless they improve their service and kitchen practices it is unlikely the high ratings will survive. The one extra star is for their wada and sambar, which was pretty good.
author: Vijay K.

description: Ordered multiple items and everything--all "mild"-- was way too spicy. Couldn't finish the meal. I expect  Indian food to have spicy options, but main dishes ordered mild shouldn't be inedibly spicy. What flavors I could taste above the spice were just ok.
author: Lisa K.

description: Just randomly came across this place while we were in the Mission. Despite the fact that the line was out the door, the hosts were sure to greet us and seated us in a short time. We ordered their chicken Curry, Chicken butter masala, and garlic naan. All were delicious. Their naan is AMAZING and fresh! My only recommendation would be to ask for very spicy if you like your food that way. My chicken masala was super tasty, I would ask for it to be more spicy next time. Other than that, definitely an awesome place to stop for food. You won't regret it!
author: Reese Y.

description: Food was awesome, service was nice but too busy to refill our water when we asked. Dosa, chicken tikka masala, and saag paneer were all great!
author: Melody C.

description: Dine in with my frnds.. my order was chilli chicken, garlic naan and gongura chicken was extremely good. Chilli fish is not up to the mark but fair enough. Biryani also good but they have to improve the taste. Service is good and friendly.
author: Sowmya B.

description: Vegan, gluten free, and if you're not into that it's still amazing! Definitely coming back. Highly recommend the chili gobi I could eat it everyday.
author: Sierra M.

description: Good Indian food right here in the mission! Loved the biryani and the service- very friendly people. Looking forward to having their dosa next time I visit!
author: Supriya G.

description: Great place in mission for Indian food. I ordered the Mysore masala Dosa and it was excellent. The restaurant has a nice ambience. Will definitely visit again.
author: Kalika S.

description: First time here--great food and service! Loved the butter chicken and the garlic naan was awesome.
author: Simona M.

description: Very fast service. Naan and vegetable tikka masala was good. Vegetable biryani was ok-ok. And they had kingfisher beer!
author: Sid K.

description: Really good, authentic home-style food. Service is always friendly and warm.
author: M M.

description: Just ate here tonight, so glad that I chose this place! the chicken tikka masala and the Lolly Lolly chicken was amazing and pares well with naan or rice. Would definitely come again!!
author: Sophie O.

description: Very good Indian food, we loved the lamb mango and the garlic cheese Nan was fantastic. Very friendly staff and good service.
author: J M.

description: This is the definitely the best Indian food I've had in San Francisco. Super flavorful and rich but not greasy. The naan is fantastic, butter chicken is perfectly tangy and sweet, awesome vindaloo, and lamb roganjosh is mind blowingly good. The place is a little small and take out waits can be long but it's totally worth it. I'm worried once the word gets out this place is going to start having long lines but the food deserves it.
author: E J.

description: The food is decent. But the service is terrible and the staff full out lie. We ordered takeout and were told to come in 30 minutes. When we arrived 35 minutes later, they told us it would be ready in 5 more. This was also a lie. They made us wait another 20 minutes before giving us our order. Good Indian food is too easy to come by to be worth enriching an incompetent and dishonest business.
author: John B.

description: We were seated quickly on a Wednesday night and our servers were very attentive. Giant dosas with great chutney and the malai kofta was fantastic paired with the garlic naan. Some of the best Indian food we've had anywhere. Highly recommended.
author: Cory D.

description: A great addition to the Valencia corridor. The menu has variety and the food is deliciously flavorful. The service is prompt and friendly. Atmosphere is casual.
author: Giuseppe C.

description: We have spent 40 years in San Francisco looking for food that was authentic to India, which we have traveled to several times. This is it! Come here! The food is exquisite and the service is lovely. A great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Joell H.

description: Food is very good, very authentic. My husband thinks this is the best Briyani he has had in the U.S.
author: T E.

description: Fantastic food, nice casual atmosphere.  Perfect for a delicious hole-in-the-wall experience!
author: Madeline W.

description: Best lamb chops in SF. I really appreciate the Chef. Delivery was so quick. I ordered two curries they gave complimentary rice with it, thats really cool.
author: Trap S.

description: Delicious South Indian food, with regional dishes not found on every menu. We especially enjoyed the dishes from Tamil Nadu state. Even the nan and samosas were unusually tasty. The chana masala had just the right amount of filling, and each sauce was more delicious than the next.
author: ZedS F.

description: Awesome South Indian cuisine, rare to find in San Francisco. Tried the mango egg dosa, paneer dosa, keema nan and malabar fish - everything was flavorful though I would have liked a little more spice in the sambhar. Will definitely be back
author: Pallavi C.

description: Yes! New gem in an old spot. We watched this place move in, & a week later we're dining here. It's a tight fit with some amazing food. We had the chicken Chettinadu - earthy, but not heavy with flavored of cinnamon & star anise - Andhra Lamb - hearty gravy with a nice smokiness - & paneer bhurji - shredded paneer in a creamy, semi-sweet sauce. We were about an hr; when we left the place had filled up, completely. The operation hrs are a huge bonus, nearly all day. We will be frequenting this place, often. Welcome to the neighborhood.
author: Steve S.

description: Delicious cuisine and hospitable hosts here! Thank you! I order the Chicken Tikka salad with rice and Naan bread. My friends ordered Tandoori Chicken. All of the food was great!
author: Joshua B.

description: I have to agree with the other 1 star reviews. Came here with high hopes since it is just 2 blocks from my house. I hate writing bad reviews for restaurants as I never want to hurt someone's livelihood. However, the husband and I left feeling somewhat ripped off. We ordered the vegetable biryani which was completely inedible. It was so salty we would have been in cardiac arrest had we finished it. We each took a few bites and left the rest. Even consuming that little of it we had to drink tons of water that night to stay hydrated. Not okay Deccan Spice. After reading other reviews, it seems they have a heavy hand with the salt. The waitress saw that we did not eat it and asked if it was okay. I told her very politely that it was too salty for us. She never offered to remove the item from our bill nor offer any compensation. We also had the chicken tikka masala (a favorite of ours from another Indian restaurant down the street with the initials AR). The chicken pieces were poor quality and flavor was lacking. We also ordered mango chutney which never came and yet remained on our bill. The story is too long to get into in this review, but suffice to say they said we got the chutney (we did not) yet they did not remove it from the bill. We were too weary to argue over $3.00. There are many other wonderful Indian restaurants in the neighborhood to choose from. I suggest going to them and not wasting your hard earned $ here.
author: Ms. P.

description: First of all, I gave 1 star for the restaurant for their hygienic problems, and the way they offer discounts on food to get high ratings on Yelp. The kitchen was disgusting. This is by far the most disgusting kitchen I've ever seen in my life. I was waiting in line for the bathroom and passed by it. Trash was all over the floor. Dirty towels and food were laying everywhere on the floor. After seeing me waiting in front of the kitchen, the manager of the restaurant told employees to close the kitchen curtain every time they came in and out of the restaurant. If they didn't, the manager would make sure they would come back and close the curtain. I visited the restaurant last night with a friend, who was Indian. I thought the food was good, but my friend did not think so. The menu was huge, and they were not even serving some of the items on the list. So what's the point of having a huge menu if you don't even serve the food? I was deeply disappointed, would not recommend it to anyone, and would never come back.
author: Vy N.

description: small spot with best South Indian vegetatarian food in mission district....good to have it welcome.
author: Easwaran M.

description: Man this started out as myself getting this restaurant mixed up with another. Checked out the reviews on Yelp and thought you know what screw it I'll give it a go! Pretty easy to find, kinda a hole in the wall place. Sat down, water was brought out, then ordered. Normal procedure. Food was eventually brought out after numerous people around us who ordered wayyyy after got their food, but I was still patient. I ordered a curry dish with chicken. If you enjoy chicken, please do. It come here. It is at lowest quality possible. Every single piece was full 97% fat garbage. Super disappointing considering some of the reviews on here? After closer look you can see most are from uber eats which is kinda funny. Giving away $20 off to new users who sign up. Id order free food from here too when I'm super high and it would prolly be great because hell free food is much better tasting right? Anyways, after the food came out (yay more Water too) our waiter didn't come by once more. Out water was left empty and every single attempt to gather anyone's attention was ignored. They were not even busy but I'm assuming it's all the uber eat orders they are pushing out the door. When I finally got the attention of someone (having to physically grab their arm) I asked for my check and they brought it over and waited over me while I was reviewing my bill. Rude. When I gave them my card they ran it, brought it back and started to take the food and drinks off my table! Um hello? I haven't even signed my signature on the receipt and you're taking the FULL drinks off my table?! And rushing me out the door? Now I suddenly get service? After I pay? Never coming here again. SF restaurants are starting to let me down more and more.
author: Alexander J.
